title: MAINTENANCE WORKER - PT / INCENTIVE $850
description:
**Why the** **Navy Exchange Service Command?**

While some may serve overseas for our country, we hold down the fort – we serve the men and women who wear the flag – America’s strength, America’s heart. We are here to guide them, and deliver our service members and their families the tools they need to do what they love to do.

* You can expect an **unforgettable, dynamic, and competitive work environment.**

**The Benefits begin DAY ONE:**

We know you work hard, and cultivate the very best solutions for your family – and that’s why the benefits we offer, you won’t find anywhere else:

* We offer a competitive **federal salary**
* Continuity Programs for Military Spouses
* Tax Free shopping, worldwide, at any Navy Exchange location

Because here at the Navy Exchange Service Command, there’s no such thing as tomorrow – there’s only today. GET AFTER IT. Seize the opportunity to grow and be community driven, too. Build a mission driven life. **Mission: YOU**.

**https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9h1WLIY3hT8** **– Heroes Welcome**

Job Summary: Performs tasks involved in the upkeep of buildings grounds fixtures equipment Navy Lodge guest rooms etc. Typical assignments include simple painting plumbing carpentry and electrical repairs. Duties and Responsibilities: Receives assignments orally or in the form of work orders. Responsible for selecting the proper tools methods and techniques to complete assignment. Receives advice guidance in connection with unusual problems. Work is subject to review both during progress and upon completion for compliance with job requirement. Performs or assists in performing all or a combination of the following - Performs minor carpentry tasks to items such as doors windows furniture cabinets platforms bins pallets etc. Uses tools such as hammers hand-saws planes screwdrivers and power tools. - Inspects and ensures the proper working condition of equipment machinery and facilities by regularly performing property walk-throughs and inspections. - Prepares surfaces and paints a variety of interior items such as shelves counters and similar items. Uses premixed paints paints surfaces according to directions cleans and maintains brushes and other painting equipment. - May assist in the installation and repair of broken pipes leaky faucets clogged drains etc. Uses such tools as wrenches hacksaw pipe cutters etc. - Performs electrical repairs to appliances light fixtures and or light switches by replacing or insulating defective wiring etc. Visually inspects repairs to ensure that damaged or broken equipment is repaired replaced properly. Utilizes a variety of tools such as test lamps ammeter etc. - Performs preventive maintenance on equipment such as fans air conditioners water coolers grills broilers heat lamps and other appliances. Cleans changes filters cleans condenser lubricates various machinery parts and makes minor adjustments to belt tensions. Cleans out dust from coolers ventilation ducts and cooling vents. - May perform preventive maintenance on forklifts hydraulic pallets jacks and conveyors checking for leaks proper water levels and that making sure that brake and clutch pedals are operating properly. Tightens bleed-off valve cleans filter oil reservoir and breather etc. - Maintains compliance with local safety regulations. Informs supervisor of hazardous conditions and unserviceable items. - Takes periodic inventory of maintenance stock and equipment as required. - May respond to customer questions regarding the operation of Navy Lodge room appliance and fixtures as applicable. - Carries out policy of courtesy and customer service. - Performs other related duties as assigned. PHYSICAL EFFORT Is required to stand stoop bend kneel climb and work in tiring and uncomfortable positions. Frequently lifts and carries material weighing up to 50 pounds. WORKING CONDITIONS Works inside and outside is exposed to dust and spray fumes in connection with painting responsibilities. Is also exposed to cuts and bruises

Qualifications - ExternalGENERAL EXPERIENCE One year of experience that provided the applicant with knowledge of general maintenance practices involving the upkeep of buildings grounds fixtures equipment etc. SUBSTITUTION OF EDUCATION FOR EXPERIENCE One year of high school education may be substituted for 3 months of general experience up to a High School Diploma or GED for one year of general experience. SPECIALIZED EXPERIENCE One year of general maintenance work in involving simple maintenance work such as painting plumbing carpentry and electrical repairs. PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS standing stooping bending kneeling climbing and work in tiring and uncomfortable positions. Frequently lifts and carries material weighing up to 50 pounds.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: From $21.45 per hour

Expected hours: 10 – 19 per week

title: Analyst, Financial Services Practice (Insurance)
description:
Position Summary
Spencer Stuart seeks to recruit an Analyst for our Financial Services Practice, ideally based in New York City. While Analysts can support several teams, we expect this Analyst to develop a focus in Insurance. Analysts plays a critical and visible role on the team. Working closely with Associates, Senior Associates, and Consultants, Analysts operate as thought partners in understanding client needs and gathering relevant research that contributes to the overall assignment strategy.
Analysts are responsible for supporting the search strategy by producing industry and/or functional analysis and reports, as well as talent pool mappings for active search assignments, internal meetings, and new business initiatives. This includes competitive information, trends across sub-sectors, target company list development and potential prospect identification. The Analyst provides research and conclusions to be incorporated into client-ready documents. Over time, it is expected that the Analyst will develop industry expertise by maintaining an awareness of industry trends and “best in class” leaders/future leaders.
Successful Analysts have the opportunity to pursue various career development paths and leadership opportunities, including a path towards Consultant, while building highly transferrable skills in research, analysis, communication, teaming, and problem solving.
The base compensation range for this position is $65-68k per year. The actual base compensation offered within this range will be dependent on the individual’s skills, experiences, and qualifications. This position will be eligible to participate in our annual discretionary bonus program.
Spencer Stuart also offers a competitive benefits package, which includes:* Retirement savings plan with discretionary profit sharing contribution and employer match;
* PTO (minimum 15 days per year, increases with tenure), paid sick time (10 days per year), company holidays (12 days per year), and paid leaves of absence when applicable;
* Comprehensive health benefits, including medical, dental, and vision insurance, and healthcare flexible spending account;
* Life Insurance, and short-term and long-term disability insurance;
* Wellness benefits, including an employee assistance program, virtual mental health program, and mindfulness program; and
* Voluntary benefit options, including supplemental life insurance, identity theft protection, and whole life insurance with long-term care and critical illness coverage.


KEY RELATIONSHIPS
Reports to
Director of Analysts
Associates and Consultants (on a project basis)
Other key relationships
Consultants, Associates, Senior Associates
Executive Assistants
Directors of Associates
Key Responsibilities* Develop a solid understanding of the potential client/client’s industry including specific information regarding the “value proposition” (competitive landscape, strengths, and weaknesses), stock performance, employee count, etc. Synthesize information accurately, so that it is easily incorporated into a readable, client-ready document.
* Maintain current awareness of news and issues associated with key client engagements and market opportunities and share that information and knowledge in a timely way with Associates, Consultants and Executive Assistants.
* Assist in high level name generation and talent mapping creation. Contribute to the long list creation by leveraging internal and external databases to provide commentary on potential candidates.
* Participate in kick-off meetings with Associates and Consultants to assist in the development of the search strategy. Directly assist Associates with search-related tasks, such as the development of a search strategy and target list.
* Develop industry and/or functional expertise by maintaining an awareness of industry trends and “best in class” leaders/future leaders.


Ideal Experience  

Successful candidates will be self-directed, independent, and able to proactively address the needs of the practice, which is often fast-paced, quick-turn work that is highly integrated with client management and day-to-day client engagement. In addition, candidates will demonstrate a passion and ability for performing critical research and communicating their findings clearly and cogently, while delivering the highest caliber service for the greatest value. They will be graceful under pressure and be excellent multitaskers with an ownership mindset and results orientation.
Specific experience should include:* Recent, or soon-to-be university graduate
* Strong academic performance is required (3.4+ GPA) and while all majors are welcome, finance, economics, or business-related degrees are preferred
* Well-roundedness demonstrated through leadership experience in internships, work experience, community service, athletics, or roles in student-led organizations
* Advanced research, analysis, and synthesis skills
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Self-directed and proactive in nature; resourceful, team-oriented, and tenacious
* Highly proficient with MS Office applications (Excel, PowerPoint, and Word)
* In possession of work authorizations necessary for the country in which you are applying


Compensation and benefits are commensurate with other high-end professional services firms.
Critical Capabilities for Success
Project Management
Plan, manage, and drive own efforts in support of new business development and search assignment support as measured by timely completion of project tasks and feedback from project team members. Handle multiple projects with competing deadlines, work with individuals who have differing styles, and manage challenging expectations.* Provide accurate and timely research information about executives, organizations, markets, or other relevant sectors.
* Take ownership of the project by doing what is needed at all phases of the research process. Anticipate next steps, and not wait to be told what to do.
* Regularly reassess priorities to align resources where/when needed and proactively reprioritize own workload to provide additional support to assignment team where/when needed.
* Deliver on commitments on-time or notify as early as possible if problems occur or deadlines will slip.


Problem Solving
Synthesize research for business development initiatives, search assignments or intellectual capital initiatives and provide a succinct and accurate point of view as measured by quality and timeliness of contribution to assignment/project objectives.* Listen and ask insightful questions.
* Leverage knowledge of an industry/function/sector and appropriate resources to gather relevant information.
* Subject researched facts to extensive analysis and interpretation before drawing conclusions.
* Make inferential leaps in thinking to reach a solution despite incomplete or ambiguous information.
* Make decisions rapidly, despite the complexity of the issues or pressures involved.
* Use effective business writing skills to create succinct, client-ready analyses and document information in Firm databases.


Impact and Effectiveness
Contribute to the efficiency and quality of teams to successfully meet project objectives as measured by Consultant, Associate and peer feedback while working with individuals who have differing styles. Be authentic.* Listen and ask questions to clarify understanding and demonstrate knowledge.
* Place team goals ahead of individual goals.
* Consider the needs of colleagues and adapt own communication style accordingly.
* Set expectations and clarify tasks to avoid wasting time and resources.
* Offer to work outside areas of responsibility when needed.
* Raise issues early and finding solutions collaboratively.
* Remain poised when under pressure or handling unexpected challenges.
* Proactively shares information with those who would benefit while being discreet.


Industry and Functional Knowledge
Obtain and incorporate knowledge to enhance client work in a meaningful way; know how to get information, effectively use the available firm resources, develop and share industry/functional knowledge.* Identify executive movements in the market and update Quest (ideally in real time) and colleagues.
* Genuine interest in/curiosity about people and businesses; actively builds personal awareness and team knowledge around the marketplace and the ecosystem of critical influencers and key agents.
* Understand how to identify and navigate the various relevant sources available (Quest, Capital IQ, D&B Hoovers, BoardEx, LinkedIn, etc.), as well as key people, leveraging both internal and external content and networks to drive distinct and unique insights and outcomes.


Development Self and Others
Develop self and others; seek and provide feedback, modify own performance or behavior based on feedback. A successful Analyst is constantly growing, learning, and enhancing his/her skills and capabilities.* Seek and be open to feedback from colleagues, place value on self-development efforts, seek opportunities for growth.
* Is self-aware and open to changing one’s own behavior.


Firm Values
Champion the Firm’s values, culture and Code of Conduct; engage, participate and collaborate with others. A successful Analyst, who people like working with, may over time also have a leadership role.* Accept others’ opinions and encourage teamwork.
* Is inclusive. Bring cultural awareness and sensitivity to each interaction with colleagues.
* Participate and contribute to internal activities; engage with office and practice.
* Represent Spencer Stuart well by speaking positively about the Firm and align behavior to Firm values.
* Conduct themselves in a way that is consistent with the Firm’s values.

*Spencer Stuart is a proud equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We are committed to non-discrimination without regard to actual or perceived race, ethnicity, creed, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions), national origin, immigration status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any basis prohibited under applicable federal, state or local law.*

title: Dental Front Desk Receptionist
description:

In addition this will include greeting patients, checking in & scheduling appointments, and handle billing .We are looking for someone with excellent communication skills, cheerful, a self-motivated team player who takes initiative to learn new things. * Positive and customer focused attitude
* Professional appearance and demeanor
* Initiative and strong work ethic
* Self-motivated and results oriented

* Ability to work closely within a group and communicate well

title: Field Service Technician
description:
We are looking for a self-starter “Field Service Technician” to perform service jobs, using our third party ticketing system app, installed on your smartphone with multimedia capabilities, GPS enabled. We provide hardware and software support for different types of clients from Corporate offices, Government, Fast food chains, Hospitals and more, located in a range that can be from 40 miles or more from your zip code (Paid Mileage). We need a tech with the best availability and the tools and knowledge required to complete the types of the job below:

Type of Works

-Desktop/Laptop -Networking -Point of Sale (POS) -Printer/copier -CCTV / Alarm Systems -Low Voltage Cabling -Server Hardware/Software -Automated Teller Machine (ATM) -Fiber Cabling -Pro A/V, Digital Signage -Smart home -UPS backup and maintenance -Rack & stack -Kiosk installation/maintenance -PC imaging

**A day in the life of our Techs includes:**  
· Providing on site services and customer support following our client’s guidelines for each site.  
· Performing on-site installations, uninstalls, repairs and preventive maintenance actions as require by the scope of work provided from our clients.  
· Using any hardware sent to us (Either to clients location or directly to your shipping address) and taking ownership on making sure parts are installed and shipped back to clients via shipping carriers (USPS, FedEx, UPS, DHL etc.)  
· Work in collaboration with other Risen Bits LLC techs, for larger scale projects at customer premises and being able to follow instructions from Lead Engineers or taking ownership if you are the lead.

**WORK SCHEDULE**

This is a Monday – Friday schedule. Might require overtime or weekends  
Generally, service requests may start anytime from 7 AM and end at 5 PM or until finish  
This position requires the ability to provide short notice over high priority tickets (flexibility is important) Travel, overtime, and work-hours other than Monday-Friday may be required

**REQUIREMENTS**

· Ability to troubleshoot, test, repair, and service hardware in general.  
· Must be proficient in English  
· Ability to work flexible shifts and to adapt to changing work schedules  
· Excellent customer service and communication skills with clients of all tempers.  
· General skills in Microsoft Office tools.  
· Must have own set of basic tools.  
· Reliable transportation.  
· Smart Phone with multimedia capabilities (Android or iPhone)  
· Successfully pass the drug screen, motor vehicle report (MVR) and background check (we do not check your credit score)

**Specific duties, activities and responsibilities include but are not limited to:**

* Have strong communication skills and the ability to interact with all levels of management.
* Must be able to follow directions when given a task from Operations Manager or designee in charge of install.
* Familiarity with networking technologies and troubleshooting.
* Provide preventive maintenance in customers hardware as requested.
* Document all inspections, maintenance, repair work and submits paperwork in a timely basis.
* Maintains clear and concise business communication, both oral and written.
* Manage all onsite test tasks (Order, install, and return parts)
* Diagnose errors or technical problems and determine proper solutions
* Follow all company’s filed procedures and protocols

**Other skills and abilities needed for this position**:

* Demonstrates ability to manage multiple tasks in a professional and timely manner
* Knowledge Mobile software applications (preferred)
* Mechanical Aptitude - Ability to correctly interpret maintenance manuals, schematics, and wiring diagrams.
* Perform physical aspects of the job, including heavy lifting of machines
* Must be able to lift 50 pounds and stand for long periods of time

***If you answer (YES) to the following questions, please apply to the job:***

***1. Have you worked as a 1099 contractor or do you understand what a 1099 contractor is?***

***2. Do you have access to a reliable transportation?***

***3. Do you own a smartphone with multimedia capabilities and GPS enabled?***

***4. Do you own a set of Basic tools? (Drill, Bit set, Screwdriver, Hex tool, Wrench set Hammer, measuring tools.***

title: Business Analyst
description:
MSIG North America continues to grow!  

Summary/Job Purpose:
The Business Analyst is responsible for understanding, analyzing, and documenting business needs and translating needs into user stories, ensuring clarity of requirements. The Business analyst works closely with the Product Owner and plays a critical role as a liaison between IT developers and the business, and mentors the business toward best practices in system utility. The Business Analyst documents business, functional and non-functional requirements ensuring tractability into test strategies and plans and supports the business users during testing and implementation.  

Essential Functions:
Percentage of Time:  

Elicit and Document Requirements 40%* Collaborate with stakeholders and Product Owners to gather detailed business requirements, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of project objectives and goals
* Translate business needs into clear, concise user stories and functional specifications, incorporating acceptance criteria and maintaining proper documentation
* Conduct thorough analyses of business process and workflows to identify gaps, inefficiencies and opportunities for improvement, facilitating informed decision-making.
* Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business processes, systems and user requirements.
  

User Story Development and Management 30%* Develop and refine user stories and acceptance criteria, ensuring they are clear, actionable, and aligned with business objectives.
* Continuously update and prioritize the product backlog in collaboration with the Product Owner, ensuring that it reflects current business priorities and project status.
* Facilitate backlog refinement sessions with the development team to ensure a shared understanding of user stories and readiness for upcoming sprints.
  

Facilitation and Communication 20%* Act as a key liaison between the Product Owner, development team, and other stakeholders, ensuring effective communication and alignment on project goals and priorities.
* Communicate complex concepts and requirements clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences, ensuring all team members understand project objectives and deliverables.
* Address and resolve any issues or conflicts that arise during the project, promoting a collaborative and productive team environment.
  

Quality Assurance and Validation 10%* Support the development team in creating and executing test plans to ensure that deliverables meet defined acceptance criteria and business requirements.
* Facilitate user acceptance testing by coordinating with end-users, gathering feedback, and ensuring that the final product aligns with user expectations and needs.
* Validate completed user stories and features by revieing and testing them against acceptance criteria, documenting any issues and working with the team to resolve them.

Qualifications: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  

Education and Experience Required:
Diploma/Degree & Experience* Bachelor’s Degree required
* 3 years Business Analyst or related work experience required
* 2-3 years of Commercial Property and Casualty insurance experience required
* Experience with Agile development methodologies

It's an exciting time for our company and a great opportunity to join a financially sound and growing global insurance group!  

It is the policy of MSIG-NA to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, MSIG-NA will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

title: Youth Volleyball Coach
description:
**Job description**

Skyhawks is actively hiring Youth Sports Coaches in the Westchester Area. If you have a passion for sports and want to have a positive impact on local youth, then this is the role for you!

**Benefits/Perks**

-*Entry-level Program Coach roles available*

-*Growth Opportunities* - *Program Director roles available to those looking to grow as leaders & gain management experience.*

-*Work with kids in sports - The best job you will ever have!*

-*Varied work locations throughout your community*

-*Flexible work schedule*

-*Free First Aid/CPR/AED certification and Positive Coaching Alliance certification*

-*Paid Coaching training*

*-Coaching resources and curriculums available*

**Job Responsibilities**

*As a Program Coach, you will:*

-*Be a great communicator and work closely with your Program Director and fellow Coaches*

-*Assist with program planning and implementation*

-*Help setup equipment and prepare participant giveaways*

-*Lead instruction with a group of participants throughout the entirety of the program*

*-Cultivate positive camp/program environment for all participants*

**Qualifications**

-*A high-energy, enthusiastic demeanor*

*-Volleyball Experience*

-*Multi-sport background preferred*

-*Flexible, adaptable, and a good communicator*

-*Responsible and committed to following through on assignments*

-*Some experience working with kids (not required)*

-*Some experience coaching youth sports (not required)*

-*Some supervisory experience (not required)*

-*Desire to build experience developing youth and/or teaching sports*

-*A passion for and interest in developing leadership skills*

**Company Overview**

With over 40 years of offering skill-based sports opportunities for children, Skyhawks is best known for beginner to intermediate instruction that helps build confidence in young players preparing them for their next step in sports. We offer:

* Skyhawks skill-based offerings that include 12 different sports across various camp and class formats for ages 4 to 14
* SuperTots classes that offer children ages 2 to 5 game-based development opportunities across 7 different sports
* STEM Sports, a one-of-a-kind program that blends the science of sports with traditional skill-based instruction

Our mission is to teach life skills through sports and we operate in hundreds of communities across nearly 30 states, providing quality sports instruction to thousands of children every year.

If this is a role that suits what you’re looking for, please apply on our website by visiting https://www.skyhawks.com/staff/application/!

title: Home Care Timesheet Specialist
description:
La’Dorch Home Care Agency is a licensed provider of high-quality home care services across the New York Metropolitan area. Our passion and deep commitment to the communities we serve drive us to hire only the most qualified staff to meet the diverse needs of our patients. Our goal is to be both the provider and employer of choice, striving to exceed the expectations of our clients and caregivers alike. At La’Dorch, we are dedicated to delivering compassionate, professional care that enhances the lives of those we serve while fostering a supportive and fulfilling work environment for our team members.

We are looking for a detail-oriented Home Care Timesheet Specialist to join our team. The Timesheet Specialist will be responsible for accurately processing and verifying timesheets for Home Health Aides (HHAs), Personal Care Assistants (PCAs), and other care staff. The role involves ensuring that all timesheets are submitted on time, verifying data for accuracy, and resolving any discrepancies. The ideal candidate will have at least 1 year of experience in timesheet processing or payroll, preferably in a home care or healthcare environment.

**Responsibilities**:

· Collect, review, and process employee timesheets for Home Health Aides (HHAs) and Personal Care Assistants (PCAs).

· Ensure timesheets are submitted accurately and on time by company policies and payroll schedules.

· Verify timesheet data, including hours worked, overtime, and breaks, ensuring compliance with state and federal labor laws.

· Accurately enter timesheet information into the payroll system or electronic records system.

· Maintain organized and up-to-date timesheet records and documentation.

· Track timesheet submissions and follow up with employees or supervisors on any missing or incomplete timesheets.

· Investigate and resolve discrepancies in timesheet data, such as missing hours, incorrect entries, or unauthorized overtime.

· Communicate with caregivers and supervisors to clarify and rectify any issues related to timesheet submissions.

· Ensure that all timesheet data adheres to company policies, state labor regulations, and healthcare industry standards.

· Collaborate with the payroll and HR teams to ensure accurate payment of wages and benefits based on timesheet data.

· Provide guidance and support to employees on timesheet submission procedures and deadlines.

· Work closely with HR and payroll departments to ensure a smooth and efficient payroll process.

description:
**Additional Information**

Seeking a Network Operations Center Network Analyst. Within this role the Analyst will oversee the configuration, layout, maintenance of the entire network. This person will also analyze, supply feedback, look for trends and provide additional technical support to the Network Control Center. The Analyst will also research and evaluate the network through our NMS tool and recommend needs where applicable. This role will also include interaction with our customer base to provide support, status and direction to ongoing initiatives. The Analyst will need to be well versed with the administration of a heterogeneous network across multiple platforms. The Analyst will work cross-functionally with internal departments, external vendors and the NOC team to coordinate corrective actions, resolve issues, provide documentation as well as metric to performance within our deployed infrastructure.

**Responsibilities:**

* Plan, validate and deploy network corrective measures as needed
* Provide network troubleshooting documentation and run books for the department

* Provide the deep dive analysis through the NMS system to proactively identify network issues
* Provide metrics (internal and/or customer facing) to management as requested related to team and network performance
* Lead all complex change management activity
* Provide feedback to management on process and procedural improvement
* Direct compilation and validation of records and reports concerning network operation and maintenance
* Effectively prioritize workload and alter as needed in the interest of the business needs
* Lead by example and drive the core values of the company
* Always ensure a quality customer experience

* Ability to manage complex issues and drive action items with customers and inter-departments

title: Retail Merchandiser
description:
Join **Hallmark** as a **Part-Time Retail Merchandiser** in **Jersey City, NJ**! This is your opportunity to represent the world's best-known greeting card brand and play a crucial role in merchandising, creating, and building displays within your territory for a positive shopper experience. We offer you work life integration within the work week, while supporting the business needs. You will be required to service stores based on the scheduling tool you are provided. We offer paid: training, travel time, and mileage reimbursement. Are you ready to **make your mark**?


**JOB OVERVIEW**  

As a Retail Merchandiser, you'll have the opportunity to work independently to showcase your organization and time management skills, your ability to establish retailer relationships, while being the face of Hallmark. You will collaborate with local store teams to optimize product placement and maintain inventory levels as well as support fellow team members with seasonal resets and installations, when needed. On occasion Hallmark may ask you to service another vendor's product in a store that you are assigned to. If that is the case, you will be provided detailed instructions and additional budgeted time.

  




**To learn more about this role, please click** **to watch our retail merchandisers in action.**  

  

**SALARY AND SHIFT DETAILS**

* Your starting pay will be between $16.50 - $16.75 depending on your shift and location.
* This is a Part-Time position with a variable schedule during the work week.
* Weekly hours for this position is between 6 – 8 hours per week
* Availability the week before and after major holidays, which may include weekends is **required**.

  


**YOUR ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE**

You'll perform service work in the Hallmark department of various retail stores such as grocery stores, drug stores, department stores, and mass retailers. The retail merchandiser position consists of three major components:


* **Day-to-day engagement:** You are responsible for the entire Hallmark product display at your assigned stores. Utilizing a mobile device provided by Hallmark, you'll restock, organize, and monitor the inventory of Hallmark products within and outside the Hallmark department. While using your mobile device you will also be in communication with your supervisor, reporting time, providing feedback, and answering surveys for required merchandising activities. Professional and courteous interaction with store employees, management, and customers is also vital for success in this role.


* **Holiday support:** Hallmark's operations revolve around seasonal demand. Leading up to and following holidays such as Valentine's Day, Easter, Mother's Day, Father's Day, Halloween, Thanksgiving, and Christmas, you can expect additional days and extended hours during the work week. On occasions like Valentine's Day, Mother's Day, and Father's Day, you may be required to work on the actual holiday itself, which may include the weekend.


* **Department Resets:** At times, you may be part of a team responsible for **installations and various tasks** like building and installing Hallmark fixtures, relocating card departments and products, as well as resetting card sections. Typically, you will be notified two weeks in advance for remodel assignments. This could include evenings or weekend.


* **One Team Vision:** As a field organization although you are assigned to your specific responsibilities there may be additional work and installation efforts that you will be asked and required to support.



**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**


This is a physically demanding job that requires a high level of energy and a sense of urgency. You will be working on the selling floor as well as in back stockrooms. You must be able to consistently push, pull, lift, and carry cartons, merchandise, and display fixtures up to 30 pounds throughout the workday and up to 50 pounds on occasion. You will also be required to stoop, squat, walk, and stand throughout your workday, and you may be required to climb stairs and step ladders.

  




**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**


* You're at least 18 years of age.
* You're able to read, write and understand English.
* You have the ability to grasp, pull, lift, and carry products up to 30 pounds frequently and 50 pounds occasionally.
* Able to operate hand-held technology provided to open and read documents and interpret information.
* You have access to a Wi-Fi network and the internet.
* You have reliable transportation to report to assigned locations.


**Prior to applying, please click** **to watch retail merchandisers at work.**

  

**Now's your chance to Make Your Mark—just follow the instructions below to apply.**


You must show how you meet the basic qualifications in a resume or document you upload, or by completing the work experience and education application fields. Accepted file types are DOCX and PDF.  

  

Part-time employees with a work schedule less than 30 hours have access to a variety of voluntary benefits through ; including dental, vision, critical illness, accident insurance, hospital indemnity and minimum essential coverage (preventive care).


#LI-AM1

title: Psychiatric Technician-Metro
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**

NYC Health + Hospitals/Metropolitan is the community hospital of choice for residents of East Harlem, northern Manhattan, and neighboring communities. The hospital provides culturally-sensitive care in a welcoming and hospitable setting, emphasizing primary care medicine and utilizing the latest advances in medical science. Metropolitan delivers high quality health services with compassion, dignity, and respect to all, without exception. Since its founding in 1875, the hospital has been affiliated with New York Medical College, representing the oldest partnership between a hospital and a private medical school in the United States. Metropolitan is a part of the NYC Health + Hospitals, the largest municipal hospital and health care system in the country.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

**Job Description**

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

1. Observes patients physical and psychosocial behavior. Reports observations to Charge Nurse/ Head, Nurse.

2. Provides care to assigned patients while reinforcing good health practices. Ensures that patient's privacy is provided.

3. Assists in monitoring patients for pain screening and reports to the charge nurse any complaints and responses to prescribed treatment.

4. Monitors patients on constant and close observation according to established protocol.

5. Documents pertinent information regarding the patient's behavior and physical condition as per established guidelines, effectively utilizing electronic as well as paper medical records, while maintaining patient confidentiality.

6. Prepares patients for examinations by performing assigned procedures such as taking vital signs, and weights, and assisting in the examination process. Collects urine specimens.

7. Assists patients in activities of daily living. Distribute meals to patients, and assist in feeding as needed. Observe food and fluid intake and output and document as needed. Assists patients with showering and laundry.

8. Participates in providing activities geared towards improving quality of life. Assist in recreational, motivational, and socialization activities. Co-Leads Community meetings, AOL, MICA, Social, and Health groups.

9. Assists in controlling aggressive patients using restrictive means as a last resort.

10. Collects pertinent subjective and objective information, and check patients’ property upon admission. Document same and report findings to Charge Nurse/Head Nurse

11. Assists in transporting patients to and from designated areas within the facility in a safe and dignified manner. Also accompanies patients on a pass or transfers to an outside facility.

12. Carries out established infection control protocols.

13. Changes linens and make beds. Help in maintaining cleanliness and orderliness of the unit including treatment rooms and patients' rooms.

14. Anticipates patients’ needs and provides care in a culturally sensitive and safe manner.

15. Maintains competence by attending staff development programs.

16. Conforms to policies governing dress code, attendance, and punctuality.

17. Assists in ensuring a safe and secure environment free of hazards to reduce the risk of injury to all customers. Makes unit rounds and checks whereabouts of all patients, makes environmental rounds. Participates in patient and unit contraband searches. Assists with the flow of visitors.

18. Communicates effectively with patients, visitors, and staff utilizing effective telephone techniques and demonstrating a courteous manner at all times.

19. Explains and instruct patients/families concerning the therapeutic regimen.

20. Attends unit meetings/conferences as assigned.

21. Participates in planning and implementing orientation programs for new patients.

22. Participates in community programs such as health fairs, as directed.

**Minimum Qualifications**

1. One year of satisfactory experience as described in Examples of Typical Tasks in a hospital, health care or medical facility; or  
2. One year of satisfactory experience in providing non-professional nursing or medical support services in a hospital, health care or medical facility and satisfactory completion of prescribed courses in an approved training program in mental health or social health care. Also the following:  
3. Ability to establish successful interpersonal relationships with patients and co-workers.  
4. Good knowledge of methods and procedures used in applying appropriate treatment.  
5. Ability to effectively carry out oral and written instructions.

**How To Apply**

If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button. In addition, you can submit your resume to METCareers@nychhc.orgwith the Job Title and Job ID # of the job posting that you applied to in the subject line of the email.

NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

title: Licensing Coordinator
company: Cipton (In-House Brand of Southern Telecom Inc.)
description:
**About Southern Telecom** 

Southern Telecom (ST) strives to improve everyday life with engaging products and cutting-edge innovation. From consumer electronics to home goods and accessories, our products are thoughtfully designed to embrace fun, function, and artistry. Throughout 30 years of growth and expansion, ST has licensed and acquired dozens of leading brands including Disney, Hurley, and Polaroid. Privately owned and managed, ST operates as a family of thinkers, makers, and creatives with one unifying vision: to keep life simple, fun, and beautiful.

**Job Overview**

The Licensing Coordinator for Product Licensing will manage and facilitate all aspects of product licensing agreements, ensuring legal compliance, contract management, and support for wholesale operations. This role requires a strong understanding of intellectual property (IP) licensing, legal documentation, and the nuances of product distribution in a wholesale environment. A background in product licensing and wholesale management is critical to ensuring contracts are handled efficiently and that licensing processes run smoothly.

**Key Responsibilities**

Product Licensing Management:

* Coordinate the application, renewal, and termination of product licensing agreements with external partners, licensors, and licensees.
* Maintain up-to-date records of all product licenses, ensuring timely renewals, adherence to contract terms, and regulatory compliance.
* Support the development of new licensing opportunities, collaborating with internal teams to negotiate and finalize product licensing deals.

Contract and Agreement Support:

* Assist in drafting, reviewing, and negotiating product licensing agreements, ensuring all terms align with business objectives and legal requirements.
* Collaborate with the legal team to interpret contract clauses, resolve legal issues, and ensure proper documentation for product licensing agreements.
* Conduct research on licensing restrictions, intellectual property laws, and product compliance to provide guidance to internal teams.

Wholesale and Distribution Coordination:

* Support wholesale teams in managing product distribution agreements that involve licensed products.
* Ensure that product licenses comply with wholesale operations, including distribution rights, territory exclusivity, pricing agreements, and marketing usage.
* Monitor wholesale and licensing agreements to ensure compliance with contractual obligations, including royalty payments, sales reporting, and performance benchmarks.

Regulatory Compliance and IP Protection:

* Stay informed on IP law and product licensing regulations to ensure compliance with domestic and international standards.
* Assist with trademark and copyright registration processes related to licensed products, working closely with the legal team.
* Manage any licensing audits or disputes, providing necessary documentation and representing the company in discussions with licensors or regulatory bodies.

Cross-Departmental Collaboration:

* Work with sales, marketing, product development, and legal teams to ensure proper execution of licensing agreements, including branding guidelines and product approvals.
* Act as a liaison between licensors and the company, ensuring communication of licensing terms, obligations, and deadlines across departments.
* Support marketing teams in ensuring that promotional materials and product packaging meet the requirements of licensing agreements.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Legal Studies, Intellectual Property, or related field. Paralegal certification is a plus.
* Minimum of 3 years of experience in product licensing, contract management, or paralegal work, preferably in wholesale or distribution sectors.
* Strong understanding of product licensing, intellectual property laws, and contract negotiation.
* Experience with wholesale operations, including knowledge of distribution agreements for licensed products.
* Excellent organizational skills with a high level of attention to detail and deadlines.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to liaise with legal professionals, licensors, and business stakeholders.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and legal management software.

**Preferred Skills:**

* Familiarity with licensing processes for consumer products, entertainment, or retail industries.
* Experience with royalty management, sales reporting, and compliance monitoring for licensed products.
* Knowledge of global IP and licensing regulations.

title: Care Coordinator (Part Time)
description:
**Why work at National EAP?**

Forty years ago, National EAP opened its doors to the business community and today is known widely for its concierge level Employee Assistance Program, Corporate Development and Training Services, as well as Management and Executive Coaching Services throughout the U.S. When you work at National EAP, you are impacting our corporate clients’ lives by providing them with education, counseling, and referral services that help them in their time of personal or workplace need. Our goal is to help our clients restore their wellbeing and achieve great success.

Please visit our website at www.nationaleap.com to learn more about us.

**Seeking:**

National EAP, Inc**.** is seeking a dedicated Care Coordinator with strong skills in case management, crisis intervention, and administrative support. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment, multitasking effectively while staying organized and professional. We are looking for someone who is warm and engaging, with experience conducting intake assessments, managing caseloads, providing immediate support to clients, and connecting them to community resources and referrals. At National EAP, Inc., we deliver concierge-style Employee Assistance to companies nationwide across various industries.

The Care Coordinator will play a key role in supporting the Client Services Department by answering phones, conducting brief intake assessments, coordinating care, and linking clients to appropriate resources and providers. They will also manage a small caseload, and occasionally consult on workplace crisis management.

**Essential Functions:**

* Conduct EAP intakes, assessments, and develop action plans
* Provide in the moment support as needed
* Coordinate with outside providers including EAP affiliates, medical providers, substance abuse facilities, psychiatric care etc. and provide case monitoring services to clients when appropriate
* Maintain up-to-date information and documentation on all client and organizational activity including managing a small caseload in the context of care coordination
* Contribute to the development of National EAP Provider and Referral Database
* Provide occasional onsite support including but not limited to benefit fairs to promote EAP as well as deliver other EAP support services, as needed
* Other duties as assigned

**Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**

* Knowledge of the EAP field (preferred)
* Excellent critical thinking, judgement, and decision-making abilities
* Strong computer and/or technical skills, specifically proficient in MS Office, Word, Excel, Outlook, and TEAMS
* Skilled in written and verbal communication with an emphasis on tact and diplomacy
* Strong work ethic and the ability to work independently
* Excellent interpersonal skills with ability to handle client relationship management, provide strong client consultative skills, and work in a fast-paced team environment
* Ability to manage sensitive and confidential matters
* Effective problem-solving skills
* Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and prioritize responsibilities

**Education**

* A Bachelor’s degree in Social Work, Human Services, or a related field is strongly preferred; however, candidates with years of strong relevant experience will also be considered
* Experience in crisis management and counseling preferred

**Working Conditions**

Fully remote position. Opportunity for hybrid work in Hauppauge, NY if interested

* Candidate must have a private work area with hardwired internet access where they will be able to work from home in an appropriate setting
* Schedule is Monday through Friday, 4 hours per day (afternoons from 1pm-5pm EST preferred)

National EAP is an EEO employer and provides an employee focused dynamic work environment. **If you are interested in becoming a National EAP Care Coordinator, please submit your resume and a cover letter.**

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $21.00 - $23.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 per week

* New York, NY (Required)

title: Installation Sales Estimator
description:
**Inside Sales Estimator – Central Region**

**How you’ll make a meaningful impact as an Installation Sales Estimator:**

Our success relies on the positive, can-do attitude of each member of the Avalon team. The Installation Sales Estimator role is integral to delivering an exceptional experience to our customers and in helping them create the homes of their dreams.

**Joining Avalon Flooring brings the following perks and benefits to support you in your personal and professional journey:**

* **Base salary PLUS commission – a successful installation sales estimator can make between $80,000-$100,000 annually – unlimited earning potential**
* 401(k) to help you invest in your future
* Employee Stock Ownership Program (ESOP), funded 100% by Avalon Flooring
* Medical (including Teladoc), Dental and Vision insurance - multiple plan options available to support your needs
* Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA) to help you pay for medical, dependent and transit expenses tax free\\*
* Company-paid life and disability plus supplemental life
* Quantum Employee Assistance and Behavioral Health program to support you and your family
* 5 sick days, 10 vacation days and 6 paid holidays to support you in having an active life outside of work
* Room for career development and advancement
* Extensive training to ensure you’re well equipped to succeed
* Guaranteed income while you’re getting up and running
* Monthly work schedules so you can plan ahead
* Business casual dress code so you can be comfortable while you work
* Employee store discounts and more perks

**Here is what you can expect in your role – also known as responsibilities:**

**Sales Responsibilities:**

* Travel throughout assigned territory to call on Retail, Commercial, and ProPartner accounts - **Coverage Areas by County Name:** Hunterdon (East of 513 & 31), Somerset (South of 78), Union (South of 78) & Middlesex (All)
* Measure projects at customer’s home or business, create diagram of room(s) for which material will be installed and review the diagram with the customer
* Drive sales and GP through selling, up selling and cross selling products and services and sell the whole project. Display and demonstrate product using samples and emphasize features
* Notify customer of any unusual circumstances due to the technical aspects of the particular job and make other recommendations when necessary. These issues must me noted on the contract
* Build the order using Selection Sheet Manager (SSM)
* Review the scope of the project with the customer and quote the prices
* Prepare the contract(s) review each contract with the customer and obtain customer’s signatures using DocuSign
* Collect proper deposit as dictated by State and Customer Type
* Estimate date of delivery/installation to customer, based on current installation availability and lead time of products
* Review Pre-Installation Guide with customer to ensure that the room(s) will be ready for installation. Obtain customers initials via DocuSign for this document
* Accurately convert SSM to an order within 24 to 48 hours of receipt of a signed contract.
* Turn in all paperwork in a timely manner
* Interact with Purchasing and Installation Departments to ensure proper ordering of material and installation
* Enter specific Next Steps for follow up in SSM within 1 hour of estimate (Typically before leaving the job, so the customer is in the loop), and follow up with Sales Associate on all unclosed estimate
* Use the appropriate price level based of the customer type. (LP, LD, TR, or PP)
* Work with Sales Associates to keep account activities and assure timely follow up
* Use Installation Sales Follow-Up Date in SSM and provide person follow up with customers
* Support Sales Associates at store level by working with customers and closing sales. Follow up on all customer issues, questions, concerns and support Sales Associates with satisfying customers’ needs
* Assist in training a Sales Associate on product, estimating, or installations. This includes Sales Associate’s traveling with Installation Sales to estimates and job sites
* Provide details and assistance to the Installation Departments as needed by investigating and resolving customer problems in timely manner
* Create new business opportunities in the local home builder, contractor, designer, and architectural industries
* Participate in weekly store meetings by reviewing field experience. This will include sharing best practices for product recommendations, update job status’ or other pertinent information to help improve the sales process
* Manage schedule to allow for participation in store meetings to include vendor presentations

**Service Responsibilities:**

* Model exemplary customer service interactions through consistent language, mindset, and technology usage that represents the Avalon way
* Demonstrate the Avalon Social Code to create a welcoming and supportive environment for all colleagues and customers in the store, on the phone, and through email communication
* Assist other colleagues’ customers as needed to provide seamless experiences
* Follow up with customers, managers, Sales Associates, and the installation department on all requests and issues

**What You Bring to the Table:**

* Comprehensive understanding of the Selling Process
* Estimating experience required
* Flooring estimating experience preferred
* The ability to work a 5-day work week that includes Saturdays. Days off are Sunday and 1 day during the week
* Ability to travel within our Central Region
* Comprehensive understanding and use of technology while working with customers
* Demonstrated math skills needed for building trades
* Minimum of 1 year of retail sales experience is preferred
* Product knowledge of flooring, flooring installation and construction
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills with colleagues and customers
* Able to identify and solve problems in a timely manner, gather and analyze information skillfully, and develop alternative solutions
* Exhibit patience and grace in managing difficult or emotional customer situations and respond promptly to customer needs
* Design sensibility to generate creative solutions to design challenges and translate concepts and information into images and contracts.
* Exceptional attention to detail and ability to modify designs using customer feedback
* Business acumen and good judgment around profitability and the customer experience
* Strong knowledge of market and competition, and Avalon’s unique competitive advantage
* Skills to coordinate and complete projects on time, within budget, and with effective communication
* Ability to embrace change within the company and any specific role
* Commitment to embodying our values that are grounded in our company’s history, culture, and ethos:
* Do the Right Thing – Always using sound judgement, even when no one is looking
* Dedicate Yourself to Excellence – Doing what needs to be done, as well as it can possibly be done
* Be Larger than Life – Using your entrepreneurial spirit to create opportunities others wish they’d thought of first

**Ideally, you’ll also have …**

* Experience in the flooring/home improvement industry
* Commission or incentive-based sales experience

**Why you’ll love working with us:**

We are committed to cultivating an environment where our team members love where they work and respect their colleagues as well as one that creates and maintains an inclusive work environment for all employees. We support diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging. We focus on our people first and demonstrate behaviors that represent our employee focused workplace that provides opportunities for growth and advancement within the company. Visit our Indeed career page or navigate to **www.avalonflooring.com** to obtain more information on our team!

***All offers of employment are contingent upon clean background check***

Life’s too short to not work someplace awesome! If you have tons of energy, love kids, and are looking for a way to give back to your community, you may be the person we are looking for!
  

  

**Why is The Little Gym a great place to work?**
* Strong sense of fulfillment
* Keep fit as you work
* Fun, high-energy work environment
* Competitive compensation
* Comprehensive ongoing career training
* Excellent opportunity for career growth and advancement

**Company Overview:**  

With more than 300 locations across the globe, The Little Gym is the world’s premier enrichment and physical development center for kids 4 months through 12 years. For over four decades, The Little Gym has helped millions of kids experience the thrill of achievement, develop new skills, and find new confidence through a variety of gymnastics-based programs. Parent/Child, Pre-K, and Grade School classes are all taught in a clean, fun, safe, and nurturing environment, which encourages children to develop at their own pace.  

  

As a part of The Little Gym team, you will be part of a family dedicated to the growth and development of children all over the globe.  

**Job Summary:*** Teach amazing classes based on our proven curriculum and teaching method (don’t worry, we’ll teach you how!)
* Provide outstanding customer service and membership experience. We treat our members like family here.
* Oversee the full of breadth offered programs to ensure the extremely high standards of The Little Gym International are met
* Oversee training and evaluation of your fellow The Little Gym team members

**You’d fit in here if…*** You’re totally open to being a goofball and love giving high 5’s. (A background in child development, physical education, and/or gymnastics helps as well)
* You live to serve! Helping others be their best, helps you feel your best
* Kids really like you, but their parents really like you too
* You were voted most likely to be in a good mood by your high school classmates
* You love to have fun but you know when to buckle down and do work

As a part of The Little Gym team, you will be part of a family dedicated to the growth and development of children all over the globe. If this sounds like the job you’ve been dreaming about, what are you waiting for? We’ve been waiting for you!
Compensation: $15.00 - $22.00 per hour  



  

  

  

**When you work somewhere this fun, it doesn’t even feel like a job.**

  



Want to wake up excited to go to work every morning, confident that you’re making a difference while having a blast? You’ve come to the right place. The Little Gym is the world’s premier enrichment and physical development center for children ages 4 months through 12 years. Programs offer children a Springboard to Life’s Adventures by using movement-based learning and imaginative play to help build the confidence and skills needed at each stage of childhood.

  



For over 40 years, our trained instructors have nurtured happy, confident kids through parent/child classes, gymnastics, dance and sports prep, plus enjoyable extras like camps, Parentsʼ Survival Nights and Awesome Birthday Bash parties. As a part of The Little Gym team, you will be part of a family dedicated to the growth and development of children all over the globe. We are looking for fun, outgoing, talented individuals who are looking to make a difference in their community. If this sounds like you, check out our open positions!

  

All associated locations are independently owned and operated by a franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchise, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of that franchise. All inquiries about employment at this franchise should be made directly to the franchisee, and not to The Little Gym Franchising Corporate.

Reporting to franchise leadership and supported by administration, this role entails execution of work orders, resource and personnel management and customer service. Ideal candidates will have a strong background in management, proven industry experience, and relevant IICRCI industry certifications . This role is suited for a dynamic leader looking to make a significant impact in a fast-paced environment. The successful candidate will be met with an aggressive career growth plan, available for corporate training and ambitious seeking to become a General Manager within three years.  

  

**Cleaning & Restoration Manager** **Responsibilities**  

  

* Oversee daily operations of the business unit including effective management of resources and technician personnel, always keeping customer satisfaction in mind.
* Perform carpet, tile, upholstery cleaning duties as needed.

title: Seasonal Intern, Social Media
description:

This person will assist in the ideating, creating and posting of content, monitoring and facilitating the social conversation, helping with analytics and the promotion of organizational priorities. This person will support all social platforms but spend significant time on YouTube, TikTok and overall social metrics.

* Help compile analytics and build campaign recaps for all Jets social platforms

* Help manage social content calendar (player birthdays, holidays, etc.) including daily content along with broader communications and marketing campaigns

title: Controller
description:
**Job Summary:**

Vertex Hospitality is seeking a Controller for our Ugly Dumpling restaurant concept. They will play a critical role in managing the financial operations of a rapidly growing, multi-location restaurant concept. With both full-service and quick-service restaurants located across the USA with plans to expand to 15+ units by mid-2025, this position requires a hands-on leader who can oversee the accounting function, ensure accurate financial reporting, and provide strategic financial guidance to support the company’s growth objectives.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Oversee all aspects of accounting operations, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, payroll, general ledger, and financial reporting.
* Ensure accurate and timely preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements.
* Manage the budgeting process, including forecasting and variance analysis, to ensure alignment with the company’s strategic goals.
* Monitor cash flow and manage working capital to support the operational needs of the business.
* Collaborate with senior leadership team and external accounting support to develop and execute financial strategies that support the company’s rapid expansion and long-term goals.
* Provide financial insights and recommendations to the executive team to inform decision-making and drive business growth.
* Participate in strategic planning sessions to evaluate new business opportunities, including potential acquisitions and new location openings.
* Coordinate and manage external audits, ensuring timely and accurate submission of required documentation.
* Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local tax regulations, including sales tax reporting and income tax filings.
* Lead and mentor the accounting team, fostering a culture of continuous improvement, collaboration, and professional development.
* Oversee the recruitment, training, and performance management of accounting staff, ensuring the team has the skills and resources to support the company’s growth.
* Implement systems and processes to improve efficiency, accuracy, and scalability within the accounting function.
* Evaluate and implement accounting software and technology solutions that enhance financial reporting, data analysis, and operational efficiency.
* Ensure the integrity of financial data by maintaining robust internal controls and regularly reviewing accounting processes.
* Lead the integration of financial systems during the opening of new locations, ensuring seamless financial operations across all units.
* Prepare and present financial reports to the executive team, highlighting key metrics, trends, and potential risks.
* Conduct financial analysis to support business decisions, such as pricing strategies, cost management, and investment opportunities.
* Develop and monitor KPIs to track the financial performance of each location and the overall business.

**Qualifications:**

* **Education:** Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field. CPA or CMA designation strongly preferred.
* **Experience:** 7+ years of experience in accounting or finance, with at least 3 years in a Controller or similar leadership role. Experience in the restaurant or hospitality industry is highly desirable.

**Skills:**

* Strong knowledge of GAAP and financial reporting standards.
* Proven ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
* Proficiency in accounting software, ERP systems, and Microsoft Excel.
* Strong leadership and team management abilities, with a focus on mentoring and developing staff.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex financial information to non-financial stakeholders.

*Vertex Hospitality Group provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability status, genetic information (including family medical history), marital status, amnesty, status as a covered veteran or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state and local laws.*

title: Superintendent
description:
Job Title: Residential Community Superintendent

Location: Highgate at Livingston, Livingston, New Jersey

Position Type: Full-Time

Availability: Starting ASAP

About Highgate at Livingston:

Highgate at Livingston is Continental Properties’ newest, luxury residential community in the heart of Livingston, NJ. Continental Properties is committed to providing an exceptional living experience for its residents. Located in the vibrant town of Livingston, New Jersey, our community is known for its high standards, superior finishes, and excellent service.

Position Overview:

We are seeking a skilled and reliable Residential Community Superintendent to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for maintaining the overall cleanliness, safety, and functionality of the community. This individual should be able to live on site, possess hands-on skills for general repair, general electrical, plumbing, and HVAC. Candidates should also be proficient in operating a lift and have a strong commitment to delivering top-notch service to our residents.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

* Maintenance and Repairs: Conduct routine inspections, identify maintenance issues, and perform repairs promptly. This includes but is not limited to plumbing, electrical, HVAC, and general handyman tasks.
* Conversion of cabinets to ADA compliant as needed.
* Groundskeeping: Ensure the exterior areas of the community are well-maintained, including landscaping, snow removal, and maintaining common areas.
* Monitoring, operating, and maintaining trash/recycle chutes and trash/recycle movement.
* Indoor and outdoor amenity maintenance, repair, and oversight: EV Charging stations, pool, pet park & washing station, firepit, Amazon lockers, mail room, plus all additional equipment and areas.
* Safety and Security: Implement and oversee safety protocols. Monitor and address security concerns to ensure a safe living environment for residents. Ensure functional cameras and footage review.
* Resident Support: Respond promptly to resident service requests and inquiries. Maintain a positive and professional relationship with all residents.
* Record Keeping: Keep accurate records of maintenance and repairs. Provide regular updates to management on the status of ongoing projects.
* Team Collaboration: Collaborate with other team members, contractors, and vendors to ensure the community's overall functionality and appearance.
* Perform emergency maintenance services while on call outside of business hours.
* Other duties as needed or as assigned by management.

Qualifications:

* 3+ Years of previous experience as a residential superintendent or similar role is preferred.
* Proficiency in operating a lift and other maintenance equipment.
* Strong handyman skills, including knowledge of plumbing, electrical, and HVAC systems.
* Ability to identify, troubleshoot, and repair common appliance problems.
* Knowledge of maintenance safety procedures.
* Ability to lead subordinates
* Excellent communication and customer service skills.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team.
* Flexibility to handle emergencies and urgent matters as they arise.
* Positive attitude and mindset, and a desire to help people.
* HVAC Certification a plus.
* Valid NJ driver's license.

title: Logistics Manager
description:
Empire Auto Parts is a leading, fast-growing provider of aftermarket collision automobile parts to independent body shops, multi-shop operators, and dealer-operated body shops across twenty states throughout the Northeast, Mid-Atlantic, and Southeast regions. Founded in 1985 and headquartered in Totowa, NJ, the company has over forty locations and employs over 800 team members.

**Job Summary:**

Empire Auto Parts is a leading aftermarket collision auto part distributor, dedicated to providing top-quality products and exceptional customer service. The Logistics Manager will oversee the efficient and effective movement of goods, from procurement to distribution. This role is crucial for ensuring that our supply chain operations run smoothly and that our customers receive their orders on time. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in logistics, supply chain management, and team leadership. An individual with strong analytical skills and excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with teams. Serving as a crucial link between our suppliers, internal teams, and transportation service providers.

**Supervisory Responsibilities:** 

Logistics team

**Duties/Responsibilities:**

· **Logistics Strategy:** Develop and implement short- and long-term logistics strategies aligned to Empire’s business scale expansion in 3-5 years to ensure TCO efficient transportation and storage of goods. This includes but not limited to current and future states lanes and modes analysis, freight market developments, geopolitical tensions, economic shifts, environmental regulations and carrier capacity management. Additionally, a contingency plan for alternatives when current lanes and/or modes encounter stoppage.

· **Transportation Management:** Work alongside operation leaders on the selection of carriers and negotiate transportation rates to optimize costs. Plan, coordinate and monitor all international and domestic freight movement.

· **Teamwork** - Collaborates and coordinates activities functionally to provide seamless and efficient logistics support to distribution centers.

· **Team Leadership:** Carry out essential leadership responsibilities such as managing, developing, and mentoring assigned team members. Set annual goals, development plan, provide coaching and address performance issues.

· **Inspires Culture of Relentless Effort**: Build a culture which promotes a “do what it takes” mentality for Logistics team.

· **Process Governance and Improvement:** Develop, maintain and update logistics SOP and work instructions and other documents /records as needed. Initiate, implement, and enforce new policies and procedures as necessary. Identify and drive process improvements to increase efficiency and reduce costs.

· **KPI Management** - Identify, implement and track appropriate KPI metrics to monitor logistics operational performance and apply countermeasures as needed.

· **Vendor Management:** Build and maintain relationships with freight forwarders and transport partners to ensure timely delivery on time every time. Communicate and problem-solving with vendors and escalate the issues when needed.

· **Compliance:** Ensure all logistics activities comply with local, state, and federal regulations.

· **Budget Management:** Prepare and manage the logistics budget, including cost forecasting and financial reporting.

· **Reporting:** Generate regular reports on logistics performance metrics, analyze data and provide actionable insights.

· **Contract Negotiation and Management:** Experience in SaaS agreement negotiation including Master Service Agreement (MSA) and statement of Work (SOW).

**Required Skills/Abilities:** 

· **Education:** Bachelor’s degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field.

· **Experience:** Minimum of 5 years of experience in logistics or supply chain management, with at least 2 years in a supervisory role.

· **Skills:**

* Strong understanding of logistics and inventory management software (e.g., ERP systems).
* Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills.
* Strong leadership and team management abilities.
* Effective communication and negotiation skills.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
* Knowledge of compliance regulations in the logistics industry.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Certification in logistics or supply chain management (e.g., APICS, CSCMP).
* Experience with international logistics and import/export regulations.
* Knowledge of lean manufacturing and continuous improvement methodologies.

**Personal/Professional Attributes:** 

**Personal Attributes:**

* **Attention to Detail:** Meticulous in managing logistics operations, ensuring accuracy and minimizing errors.
* **Problem-Solving:** Proactive in identifying issues and developing effective solutions.
* **Adaptability:** Flexible and able to adjust to changing circumstances and priorities.
* **Integrity:** Honest and ethical in all dealings, maintaining the highest standards of professionalism.
* **Resilience:** Able to handle pressure and maintain composure in high-stress situations.
* **Team Player:** Collaborative and supportive, with a strong sense of teamwork and cooperation.

**Professional Attributes:**

* **Leadership:** Strong leadership skills with the ability to motivate and guide a team to achieve goals.
* **Analytical Thinking:** Able to analyze complex data and make informed decisions to optimize logistics processes.
* **Communication:** Excellent verbal and written communication skills, capable of conveying information clearly and effectively.
* **Organizational Skills:** Highly organized, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
* **Strategic Planning:** Skilled in developing and implementing strategic logistics plans that align with business objectives.
* **Technological Proficiency:** Proficient in logistics management software and other relevant technologies.
* **Customer Focus:** Committed to meeting the needs of both internal and external customers, ensuring high levels of satisfaction.
* **Project Management:** Experienced in managing projects from conception to completion, ensuring timely and within-budget delivery.
* **Financial Acumen:** Strong understanding of budgeting, cost control, and financial reporting within the logistics context.
