title: Ophthalmic Technician
description:
**Job Summary**  
The Ophthalmic Technician will assist ophthalmologists in providing eye care services to patients. This role involves various clinical and administrative tasks within an ophthalmology clinic setting.

**Duties**  
- Conduct preliminary patient screenings including visual acuity, intraocular pressure, and lensometry  
- Prepare examination rooms with necessary equipment and instruments  
- Assist with diagnostic tests such as visual field testing and OCT scans  
- Educate patients on eye care procedures and post-operative care  
- Maintain accurate patient records and update medical histories  
- Perform basic optical tasks including contact lens insertion and removal  
- Utilize electronic medical record systems for documentation

**Skills**  
- Proficiency in pediatric ophthalmic procedures  
- Knowledge of optical principles and equipment  
- Familiarity with aseptic techniques for maintaining sterile environments  
- Experience with medical billing processes  
- Ability to use electronic health record systems like Epic  
- Understanding of medical coding and terminology  
- Strong communication skills to interact effectively with patients and staff

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $23.00 per hour

* Staten Island, NY 10301 (Required)

* Staten Island, NY 10301: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: PKG Delivery Driver

title: Desktop Support Specialist
description:
Job Overview:  
We are seeking a skilled Deskside support specialist to join our team. The position of Desktop Engineer – End User Computing performs troubleshooting, repair, and preventative maintenance of end user computing equipment and peripheral equipment at corporate locations.

The candidate works on assignments of a diverse scope where analysis of data and hardware requires evaluation of identifiable factors. The candidate exercises judgment with supervision within the generally defined practices and policies in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions and acts as a liaison between customers, departments, and within the organization to lead problem resolution.

Essential duties for the position include, but are not limited to the following:

* Provide onsite support to Authorized Users with operational and technical support and to meet specified SLAs
* Resolve incidents and problems associated with EUC equipment
* Perform reactive troubleshooting to effectively identify potential incidents or problems, and attempt to eliminate them to occur in the future
* Support Authorized Uses connecting or attempting to connect to corporate network and assist in the coordination and completion of accessing LAN, print, and file services; connection to WAN; and accessing appropriate LAN segments
* Provide repair and maintenance for mobile devices
* Install, upgrade and repair EUC equipment (desktops, laptops, monitors, and associated peripherals)
* Provide software break/fix services and replacement of non-warranty assets for end-users

title: Social Worker - Per Diem
description:
The Social Worker is a member of an interdisciplinary team responsible for assessment, treatment and the provision of direct treatment services to mental health and/or chemical dependency behavioral health patients utilizing a variety of clinical social work treatment techniques and modalities. Adheres to Mercy Hospital/department policies and procedures and JCAHO/regulatory agency requirements. Demonstrates and promotes service excellence at all times.

**This is a per diem position that will require 3 shifts per 4 week period.** 

**Responsibilities:**

* Demonstrate consistent ability to perform clinical social work skills necessary in the care & treatment of mental health/substance abuse outpatients
* Conduct comprehensive assessments, individual, family, group therapy & crisis intervention as per patient's treatment plan
* Initiate follow-up and outreach on all canceled and no show appointments and inactive cases
* Maintain or exceed patient care departmental productivity standards. Actively manages daily schedule and promptly engages newly assigned patients
* Complete acceptable psychosocial assessments, patient consent forms, patient education assessment and discharge summaries as per departmental requirements
* Participate in educational programs, in-service meetings, workshops, conferences and committees. Keeps abreast of current literature and professional trends

**Qualifications:**

* MSW/DSW/PHD in Social Work from a school accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE)
* Active LCSW by the State of New York or Limited Permit
* Prior experience with mentally and /or chemically dependent population required
* Prior experience with provision of verbal therapies and/or clinical social work treatment preferred

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $49.20 per hour

Expected hours: No less than 7.5 per week

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Education:

* Master's (Required)

Experience:

* mentally and /or chemically dependent population: 1 year (Required)

License/Certification:

* LCSW (Required)

title: Area Manager (Janitorial)
description:
**Company Overview**

Our Company is an industry-leading provider of comprehensive facility maintenance services for commercial and residential properties of all sizes. We utilize customized technology and specialized systems to support our team of trained professionals, helping us deliver exceptional services to our customers. Founded in 1992 and currently servicing over 10mm SQF with over 500 employees, our company has evolved to include specialists in commercial cleaning, engineering and operations, architectural maintenance (metal, marble and wood), pest control, security, and lighting and energy solutions. And we’re about being sustainable, for your budget and the environment. It’s why we’re the fastest growing team in the eastern US.

**OUR VALUES:** Our company is comprised of a set of operating principles called "core values". They are “Mary Minds, One Mission; Everything with Integrity; Be Accountable, and Adapt & Grow. These core values serve as the foundation for who we are as a company, how we conduct business, interact with our customers, and, last but certainly not least, each other. We have a grand vision to be the best at what we do while also "Building a Great Place to work".

**Diversity Statement:** Our Company is committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion. Our human capital is the most valuable asset we have. The collective sum of the individual differences, life experiences, knowledge, inventiveness, innovation, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talent that our employees invest in their work represents a significant part of not only our culture but our reputation and company’s achievement as well.

We embrace and encourage our employees’ differences in age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other characteristics that make our employees unique.

**SUMMARY/OBJECTIVE:** The Area Manager (AM) is responsible for managing a caseload of diverse accounts by organizing and overseeing its operations. The Area Manager will assume responsibility for supervising their staff’s performance, follow a schedule of inspections, train employees, troubleshoot accounts with deficiencies, and strategically manage a workforce. The AM will strive to attain the success of all their accounts by meeting or exceeding the client’s expectations.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS and BASIC RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Setting up of new jobs, Work Orders, Staff Coverage (Call-Outs, New Jobs, etc.),
* Quality Assurance Inspections/ Quality control (Performing inspection reports)
* Responding to and Managing Client Complaints
* Training of employees
* Close out account Deficiencies
* Ensuring the scope of work is being adequately carried out at each account
* Visiting sites according to a pre-defined schedule and relationship managing the account
* Manage ~60 Client Accounts in the NYC Region
* Manage ~50 Staff (Porters)
* Maintaining Equipment and the company vehicle
* Operate Floor Equipment (Side by Side, Burnisher, Pressure Washer, Auto Scrubber, Buffer, Extractor)
* Work on the Weekends/Emergencies (ie: Work after-hours in the event of a client emergency)

**COMPETENCIES/SKILLS:**

* Management Experience
* Cleaning / Janitorial Experience
* Bi-lingual (English and Spanish)
* Possess a Valid Driver’s License
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Outlook, Word)
* Customer/Client Focus.
* Ethical Conduct.
* Stress Management/Composure skills
* Attention to detail and high level of accuracy
* Effective Organization & Time management skills
* Ability to work proficiently in a fast-paced environment
* Strong written and verbal communication skills

**Physical Demands:** Stand, walk, or sit alternately, depending on specific daily demands. Infrequent lifting and/or carrying of bulk supplies weighing up to 25+ pounds (with assistance as necessary). Up to 25% of the time may have to perform the following physical activities: bend/stoop/squat: crawl: climb stairs/ladder: kneel” push or pull: twists torso: reach above shoulder level. Talking. Expressing or exchanging ideas using the spoken word. Those activities in which they must convey detailed or important spoken instructions to other workers accurately, loudly, or quickly. The worker is required to have visual acuity to determine the accuracy, neatness, and thoroughness of the work assigned or to make general observations of facilities or structures. The employee may be subjected to long periods of sitting, typing, or looking at a computer screen.

**Environmental Conditions:** The worker is subject to both environmental conditions. Activities occur inside and outside.

**Mental Demands:** There are several deadlines associated with this position, which may cause significant stress.

**EEO Statement:** We are an equal opportunity employer. It is the policy of the company to hire, train, promote and pay its associates without regard to age, immigration or citizenship status, color, disability, gender (including sexual harassment), gender identity, marital status and partnership status, national origin, pregnancy and lactation accommodations, race, religion/creed, sexual orientation, and status as a Veteran or Active Military Service Member.

**Disclaimer:** The above statement is intendant to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by the incumbent (s) of the job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and activities required of the position. Other duties, responsibilities, and activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice.

title: Assist Director (Hosp) Level III
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


Queens Hospital Center is making good on its promise to the people of southeastern and central Queens to maximize both patient convenience and positive clinical outcomes. Residents of Queens can count on the delivery of quality medical care right in their own borough. In 2002 the hospital opened a state-of-the-art, 261-bed facility that includes the Queens Cancer Center, the first comprehensive cancer treatment center in the borough.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Work Shifts**
---------------

  


11:00 A.M – 7:00 P.M

  

**Job Description**
-------------------

  


1. Supervises and coordinates functional activities of the health care setting with other organizational units and maintains liaison with internal and external partners; prepares reports related to functional activities.  

2. Assists in the preparation of operating plans, policies, programs and procedures; assists or collaborates with appropriate staff in resolving operating problems to facilitate solutions.  

3. Coordinates and plans training programs and activities to establish performance standards; provides education and training to staff, as needed.  

4. May represent departmental leadership on various internal and external committees and in relevant functions and programs.  

5. Provides assistance to departmental leadership in a wide-range of activities in the management of a health care setting and/or medical center, including such areas as health care setting administration and administrative systems, professional, operational and related support activity services.  

6. Assists in the administration management of specified activities and functions. Carries out assignments and undertakes studies involving the total service center or specific patient services, including budget planning, cost studies/analysis, and preparing specific budgets.  

7.Collects and analyzes data needed as a basis for administrative and management decisions relative to various health care setting activities.  

8.Accumulates data for budget preparations, fiscal reports, and review of budget estimates.  

9. Investigates and reports on patient and visitors complaints and performs special studies and investigations on operational units.  

10.Prepares and develops informational data in health care setting training programs, and participates in the development and updating of activity programs.  

11.Plans, directs, coordinates, controls and reviews work of subordinate administrative personnel relating to assigned tasks and projects in health care setting administration, health care setting management and related fields.  

12. Implements new programs and projects and monitors their operation and effectiveness.  

13. Performs other related duties, as directed.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. Master’s degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in hospital administration,  

health care administration, public health or a related discipline; or  

2. Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university in disciplines, as described in “1” above,  

and one (1) year of administrative experience; or  

3. An equivalent combination of training, college education and experience in related fields.


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online at employment.nychhc.org.


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs
company_description: We always put patients first! NYCHHC is committed to excellence in health care and the safety of people in the City of New York.

title: Staff Product Mgr, Machine Learning
description:
***Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.***

**Who We Are…**

When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the *storytellers* bringing our characters to life, the *creators* bringing them to your living rooms and the *dreamers* creating what’s next…


From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.


We are the now and the next. The power behind the people building the future. We are born from the spirit of innovation. We are created from the idea that people around the world want more, need more, deserve more. We are the home of the global digital revolution. We are CNN.


To see what it’s like to work at CNN, follow @WBDLife on Instagram and X!


Your New Role… We are CNN. THE WORLD'S MOST ESSENTIAL AND ENGAGING SOURCE OF DIGITAL NEWS. We are in the midst of rapid transformation and need our next generation of innovators, makers, and dreamers who will lead and drive our growth. We aim to make the world a better, more connected place. The Staff Product Manager, Machine Learning is responsible for driving CNN's search, personalization, and recommendations initiatives in partnership with product experience teams. High levels of user engagement and satisfaction are the hallmarks of a delightful product experience, and you are passionate about making this happen for users who come to CNN. You think in the domains of machine learning and AI and are equally comfortable with design thinking to tie the best user experience and ML models together. You are adept at understanding the technical aspects of recommendation systems including understanding API contracts and writing SQL queries to dive into the data. You enjoy collaborating with other product managers, data scientists, researchers, engineering, designers, and editorial teams to deliver the best personalized experience that balance user needs and business goals. Your Role Accountabilities… • Drive CNN digital's personalization, search, and recommendations initiatives across multiple platforms (apps, web, and TV) with multiple content types (articles, videos, products, etc.) • Partner with cross-functional teams in engagement, growth, commerce, and editorial of product managers, designers, researchers, data scientists, engineers, and editors to integrate machine learning models and personalization features across various product portfolios • Devise, monitor, and analyze key performance metrics and use data-driven insights to expand personalization reach and increase quality of recommendations to consistently drive user signups and engagement metrics month after month • Conduct quantitative and qualitative research in collaboration with data scientists and researchers to inform personalization and recommendations strategies, validate hypotheses, identify user needs, and drive continuous improvement. • Lead the machine learning platform and data science product strategy, define key metrics, roadmap and quarterly OKRs in partnership with ML engineering and science teams • Communicate product updates, progress, and results to stakeholders at all levels, ensuring alignment with organizational goals. • Ensure that all personalization initiatives comply with privacy regulations and adhere to industry best practices. Qualifications & Experience… • At least 7 years of product management experience, ideally with consumer facing product experience with Machine Learning and AI components • Proven track record of managing and delivering complex product initiatives in working with a full stack team • Strong understanding of personalization techniques, recommendation engines, and AI/machine learning applications, with a passion for algorithms and their potential in driving user engagement • Experience in designing, implementing, and running online experimentations • Comfortable writing SQL queries and have experience working with data scientists and data analysts to define and measure KPIs • Strong presentation and communication skills in delivering strategies to cross-functional leadership teams and gaining support**How We Get Things Done…**


This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.

**Championing Inclusion at WBD**


Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.
If you’re a qualified candidate and you require adjustments or accommodations to search for a job opening or apply for a position, please contact us at recruitadmin@wbd.com.
In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles in locations where legally required. Actual salaries will vary based on several factors, including but not limited to external market data, internal equity, location, skill set, experience, and/or performance. Base pay is just one component of Warner Bros. Discovery’s total compensation package for employees. Pay Range: $114,100.00 - $211,900.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and sick time and vacation.

title: Vice President - Capital Solutions Group
description:
Region
Americas
Business Unit
Financial Advisory
Location
New York
Job Description
Lazard is one of the world’s leading financial advisory and asset management firms. Our people make the difference. With just over 3,000 employees, our tight-knit community allows for professionals eager to learn and willing to teach to connect and grow together. We believe that diversity, equity, inclusion, and allyship are not just business imperatives — they are central pillars of our employee experience. Our entrepreneurial culture and flat structure allow creative ideas and original concepts to drive our business forward — and for careers to take flight.


Through our financial advisory business, Lazard advises clients around the world on strategic and financial matters including mergers and acquisitions, restructurings, capital structure and capital raising. Our client relationships are built on trust and discretion. As the world’s largest advisory-focused firm, we have exceptional depth of expertise across industry sectors and geographies. We value the rich diversity that comes from blending local perspective with our global network.


The Capital Solutions team supports Lazard’s corporate and sponsor clients in capital raising efforts including private market syndication and public market execution in the context of M&A, refinancing, liability management, and new capital projects. The team’s objective is to create market-agnostic solutions for our clients: one team working with our clients to pick the best market and optimal product for their situation and executing on the company’s behalf. We work across all leveraged finance products, in both public and private markets, which will also include preferred equity and junior capital solutions. The candidate will also be exposed to private market investment grade alternatives.


As part of the Capital Solutions team, the Vice President will work with the small team with clients across all sectors and interact with Lazard bankers in every group to connect the public and private financing markets to Lazard’s clients. Candidates will receive exposure to all aspects of a financing transaction, from origination to negotiation to execution and cultivate corporate and investor relationships. The Capital Solutions team is small and nimble and is looking for a highly motivated individual to assist in our growth.

**We’ll trust you to:**

* Manage syndication processes across capital products
* Prepare and create client presentations and meeting materials
* Track market developments and transactions
* Interact with senior bankers and clients

**You’ll need to have:**

* 5-6 years of experience in capital raising capacity, ideally in the broad private/syndicated leveraged finance markets (both sellside and buyside) but open to other backgrounds
* Knowledge of sub-investment grade debt markets, debt documentation, acquisition financing, debt underwriting standards and transaction syndication process
* Experience working with investors to syndicate deals
* Strong analytical and communication skills
* Interest in broadening skillset beyond a single product in financial services

**What we offer:**


We strive to enhance the total health and well-being of our employees through comprehensive, competitive benefits. Our goal is to offer a highly individualized employee experience that enables you to balance your commitments to career, family, and community. When you work for Lazard, you are working for an organization that cares about your unique talents and passions, and will continue to invest in the development of your career.


We expect the base salary range for this role to be approximately $250,000 - $275,000 USD. Various factors contribute to determining the actual base compensation offered, including but not limited to the applicant’s years of relevant experience, career tenure, qualifications, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held, and relevant skills for the role. Base salary is one component of Lazard Financial Advisory’s compensation package, which also includes comprehensive benefits and may include incentive compensation.

**Does this sound like you?**


Apply! We’ll get in touch on the next steps.

**Inclusion at Lazard**


Lazard is an intellectual capital business focused on delivering the best advice and solutions to clients. Achieving these objectives requires us to identify, develop and retain the best talent. A workforce comprised of people with varied backgrounds and experiences creates a rich diversity of thought that empowers us to challenge conventional wisdom, as diverse perspectives lead to better decisions.


Our appreciation of diversity’s strength is ingrained in our multi-cultural heritage. As a global firm that has grown organically from local roots in different countries, we have a deep tradition of respect for individual differences, which has been core to our success for several decades.


The ongoing cultivation of diversity and an inclusive, equitable culture are essential to our continued growth. We are committed to sustaining an environment in which all employees – regardless of socioeconomic status, race, color, nationality, religion, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, physical abilities, veteran or military status – can maximize their individual potential and our collective success. #LI-EF1
company_description: We value individual differences and operate with a flat management structure in which everyone contributes.

title: Boiler Operator Blue Seal-Hunterdon County
description:
**Job Summary**:


**Duties/Responsibilities**:


* Operate and monitor boilers in strict adherence to New Jersey Boiler and Pressure Vessel Compliance standards, ensuring safe and efficient performance.
* Maintain an in-depth understanding of New Jersey's boiler regulations (N.J.A.C. 12:90) and ensure all operations align with state-specific requirements.
* Conduct regular inspections of boilers and associated equipment, addressing any issues promptly to maintain optimal efficiency.
* Ensure compliance with the National Board Inspection Code (NBIC).
* Keep detailed and accurate records of boiler operations, inspections, and maintenance activities as required by New Jersey regulations.
* Enforce and adhere to New Jersey safety protocols, including routine safety checks, equipment testing, and emergency procedures outlined in the New Jersey Administrative Code.
* Provide training to boiler operators, emphasizing compliance with New Jersey regulations.
* Coordinate and oversee the work of subordinate operators.
* Diagnose and troubleshoot malfunctions or abnormalities in boiler systems, coordinating with maintenance teams for effective solutions.
* Identify opportunities to enhance the efficiency of boiler operations in line with New Jersey's energy efficiency standards.
* Recommend adjustments or upgrades to equipment.
* Develop and implement emergency response plans for equipment failures or malfunctions, ensuring compliance with New Jersey regulations.


**Required Skills/Abilities**:


* In-depth knowledge of boiler systems, controls, and associated equipment in accordance with New Jersey regulations.
* Familiarity with New Jersey's safety standards and regulations.
* Excellent communication and leadership skills


**Education & Experience**:


* High school diploma or equivalent; additional vocational or technical training in boiler operations is a plus.
* Blue Seal Boiler Operator License issued by the New Jersey Department of Labor and Workforce Development.
* Minimum One Year in boiler operation and maintenance, with expertise in systems covered by the Blue Seal license.


**Physical Requirements**:


* Ability to lift and carry heavy equipment and tools.
* Comfort working in confined spaces.


Physical stamina

description:
Leading Career Vocational School is looking for a Career Services Advisor. The Career Services Advisor will be responsible for counseling students regarding their job search, generating new job leads and providing continuous follow up with prospective employers, existing employers, students and graduates to ensure that their needs and requirements are being met. Additionally, the Career Services Advisor is responsible for working with instructors, and being present in the classroom for career counseling on a weekly basis. This position entails heavy phone work. Sales or recruiting experience is a plus.

1. Experience working in sales, recruiting or for a proprietary school in admissions or career services a plus.

2. Minimum one years experience with heavy business development via cold calling is a must.

3. Strong customer service skills.

title: Assistant Property Manager
description:
The Bridge is an innovative and well-respected mental health agency serving adults with serious behavioral health diagnoses, substance use issues, and co-occurring medical conditions. The Bridge envisions a world where adults with mental illness can thrive in the Community. Our mission is to change lives by offering help, hope, and opportunity to vulnerable adults in New York City. We work from a Harm Reduction, Trauma-Informed perspective and acknowledge the impact that systemic racism has had on the communities we serve.

**Essential Position Functions:**

* Manage, organize and catalog all current scattered site leases.
* Ensure all rent invoices are mailed to tenants on time monthly.
* Assist with rent collection, and meet with tenants as needed.
* Assist with data entry in Real Page/Onesite.
* Track all court cases and manage an active calendar.
* Perform general administrative duties including copying, filing and assisting with recertification charting.
* Assist with special quality assurance projects including audits and visits by funders.
* Gathers all income and identification information for apartment applicants.
* Follow up on any missing documents with relevant staff and third parties.
* Prepares leases and apartment documents for initial and re- certifications.
* Screens all incoming calls, transfers them to the appropriate staff, and takes and distributes messages.
* Reconcile received payments for bank deposit.
* Attend internal and external meetings, supervision and trainings as required.
* Assist with creating and sending certified letters such as, but not limited to, rent demands, recertification notices, benefit letters, etc.
* Attend internal and external meetings, supervision and trainings as required.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Qualifications:**

* Associates Degree preferred, High School Diploma or GED required.
* Knowledge of tax credit and HUD certifications is a plus.
* Strong interpersonal communication and organizational skills.
* Excellent time management skills.
* Experience with *Real Page Onesite* property management a plus, MS Excel, and knowledge of AWARDS.
* Spanish speaking a plus

**The Bridge Inc. is an Affirmative Action / Equal Opportunity Employer**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $40,000.00 - $45,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Tuition reimbursement

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

* Could you please describe your experience with tax credit and HUD certifications? Include any relevant certifications or training you have completed.

Education:

* Associate (Preferred)

Experience:

Language:

* Spanish (Preferred)

title: Store Manager
description:
Would you like to join a fast-growing lifestyle brand, helping to further its continued retail growth? Could you be instrumental in making sure customers receive an exceptional experience, again and again? Then you could be Rains’ new Store Manager in our new luxury outlet store in Belmont Park Village, Long Island.

We’re looking for you if you thrive in an informal but ambitious work culture, and enjoy working with a strong driven team within the Retail business.

**The role**

Rains is looking for a Store Manager with a great personality to lead a talented and ambitious team of retailers in our store, located in Belmont Park Village. As Store Manager one of your most important tasks is to take care of the daily operations of the store, including employment matters.

Furthermore, the role includes:

* Integrating all collections within the store, making sure staff are educated about the pieces.
* Showing passion and excitement for the brand and products through storytelling and engaging communication skills.
* Converting walk-in traffic to buying customers and ultimately brand ambassadors by creating energy, excitement, and desire for the product and brand.
* Upholding the visual display of all products in accordance with Rains visual standards
* Being a team player and partner with fellow colleagues. Fostering open and constructive colleague dialogue to ensure a consistently exceptional experience and contribute to a positive working environment.
* Fostering productive communication with Rains HQ, regarding the store’s fulfillment of internal requirements.

The position is full-time.

**The ideal candidate**

We are looking for a candidate who have experience in a leadership role from former employment. It is a plus if you have experience in either retail, sales, or service. As a person you can build long-lasting relationships with customers and colleagues, you are accuracy, and pay a lot of attention to detail in your work. It is important that you are a team-focused leader with a desire to collaborate effectively with the entire team.

Furthermore, we expect that you are/have:

* Able to work in a fastmoving and dynamic environment, and able to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Motivated by learning as a part of becoming an integrated part of a dynamic business.
* Flexible and able to adapt to different customers, as well as being able to work with a flexible schedule based on the needs of the business. This includes evenings, weekends, and holidays.
* Excellent communication skills in English, both oral and written.

**What we offer**

To be a part of a fast-growing dynamic company, as a part of a social, dynamic, and committed team of colleagues.

Working in a role with great impact on the business, with freedom under responsibility.

Possibility of further development of your future career within Retail.

We look forward to receiving your application

If you could see yourself in this position and want to be a member of a fast-growing brand, please submit your application below. We will review and contact applicants continuously, so please do not hesitate to apply.

All qualified applicants regardless of age, gender, religion, and ethnicity are encouraged to apply for the position.

Jobtype: Fuldtid

Løn: $46.000,00 - $56.000,00 pr. år

Arbejdssted: Personligt fremmøde

title: Lead of Human Resources
description:
La’Dorch Home Care Agency is a licensed provider of high-quality home care services across the New York Metropolitan area. Our passion and deep commitment to the communities we serve drive us to hire only the most qualified staff to meet the diverse needs of our patients. Our goal is to be both the provider and employer of choice, striving to exceed the expectations of our clients and caregivers alike. At La’Dorch, we are dedicated to delivering compassionate, professional care that enhances the lives of those we serve while fostering a supportive and fulfilling work environment for our team members.

We are seeking a dynamic and dedicated Home Care Director of Human Resources with at least 1 year of experience in HR, preferably within the healthcare or home care sector. The Director of HR will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of the human resources function, including recruitment, employee relations, compliance, and staff development. The ideal candidate will have a passion for building a positive workplace culture, ensuring compliance with state and federal regulations, and supporting the growth and development of employees within a home care environment.

**Responsibilities**:

· Serve as a point of contact for employee concerns, resolving issues promptly and effectively.

· Foster a positive workplace environment by promoting open communication and employee engagement.

· Handle performance management, conflict resolution, and disciplinary actions as necessary.

· Ensure compliance with all applicable state, federal, and local employment laws and regulations (e.g., labor laws, wage and hour laws, etc.).

· Maintain and update employee records, ensuring accuracy and confidentiality.

· Ensure compliance with healthcare-specific regulations, including staff credentialing and training requirements.

· Identify training needs and work with department heads to develop and implement employee development programs.

· Coordinate ongoing professional development for staff, ensuring compliance with mandatory training in healthcare.

**Requirements:**

· High School Diploma or equivalent required.

· Minimum of 1 year of Director HR experience, preferably in the home care or healthcare industry.

· Familiarity with healthcare-related HR compliance and labor laws is a plus.

· Proficient in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel).

· Must be organized and detail-oriented with excellent listening, written, and oral communication skills.

· Strong leadership, organizational, and interpersonal skills.

· Self-motivated, able to work independently and with teams, multitask, and make sound decisions when needed.

· Proven experience in program development and management

· Ability to effectively supervise and lead a team

· Bilingual (Spanish/English or Russian/English) in other languages is a plus

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $55,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Travel RN - Hospice / Home Health
description:
**Start-Up & Survival Travel Team RN - Registered Nurse**

This position will function as part of our start-up and survival team (S&S). As we expand our footprint, presentation, articulation, and a strong skill set are crucial for introducing our brand. Team members will manage the initial setup and transition to the permanent clinical team through onboarding and training. They will be or will become MatrixCare power users. Our team ensures seamless operations during growth, extended PTO, or other gaps. These team members prevent extra strain on the team, keeping patient care our top priority.

**This position will require a person to travel between Connecticut and New York to assist hospice and home health branches weekly.** 

**Responsibilities:**

* Deliver compassionate and comprehensive nursing care to patients facing end-of-life challenges.
* Provides skilled nursing care including administration of medications and treatments
* as prescribed in the physician’s plan of care for patients in their home setting.
* Conduct thorough assessments to identify patient needs and develop individualized care plans.
* Ability to travel up to 100% of the time.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

**Qualifications:**

* Current and active RN license in the state of employment.
* We are seeking individuals who either hold an RN license or are willing to obtain one in the following states: CT, NY, MA, NH, ME, TX, OH, NJ, PA, and VA.
* Compact RN license is preferred.
* Bachelor’s degree in nursing (BSN) preferred.
* Minimum of 1 year of experience in hospice and home health.
* In-depth understanding of end-of-life care principles and practices and certified home health.

**What We Offer:**

* Competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package that includes 401(k), mileage reimbursement, health insurance and PTO ***(must meet minimum requirements to be eligible for benefits)***
* Opportunities for professional development and training to advance your career.
* A Supportive and collaborative work environment that values compassion and empathy.
* The satisfaction of making a profound difference in the lives of patients and their families.

**Why Constellation?**

* ***Family-Centered Culture:*** At Constellation, we treat our team members like family. We understand that exceptional patient care starts with a happy and supported workforce.

title: The Daily Pilates Instructor - Summit
description:
**Job Overview**  
**The Daily Pilates Summit, NJ franchise is hiring!** 

The Daily Pilates is a beautiful wellness studio known for creative classes, beautiful spaces, and a strong focus on proper form/alignment. Our Summit location is looking for passionate Pilates Instructors who want to inspire and motivate our clients to be the best versions of themselves.

Your Role:  
As one of our Pilates instructors, you’ll guide both group classes and private sessions. You’ll bring your expertise in mat and reformer techniques, a deep understanding of anatomy, and a talent for tailoring exercises to meet individual needs.

What You’ll Do:  
- Lead group Pilates classes and/or one-on-one sessions.  
- Ensure clients perform exercises with the correct form and technique.  
- Keep our studio sparkling clean and safe.  
- Stay ahead of the curve with the latest TDP education.  
- Foster strong, positive connections with clients and fellow staff.  
- Participate in team meetings and training to keep our vibe fresh and exciting.

What You Bring:  
- Certified Pilates Instructor credentials from a recognized program.  
- Hands-on experience with both mat and reformer Pilates.  
- A solid grasp of anatomy and physiology.  
- Skill in adapting exercises for clients with various needs and limitations.  
- Stellar communication and people skills.  
- A knack for working with clients of all ages and fitness levels.  
- Flexibility to work evenings and weekends.  
- An unbridled passion for health, fitness, and wellness.

Perks:  
- Competitive pay  
- Flexible hours  
- Instructor discounts  
- A supportive, fun-loving team atmosphere.  
- Ongoing training to help you grow and shine in your career.

Ready to Inspire?  
If you’re a certified Pilates instructor who thrives on helping clients reach their fitness goals, we’d love to hear from you! Please send your resume to mailto:summit@thedailypilates.com  
Bonus points if you include a short video showcasing your teaching style and technique!

Extra Details:  
- Must have at least 1 year of teaching experience.  
- Preferred 2 years of customer service experience.  
- At least 1 year of group fitness experience is a plus.  
- CPR/AED Certification is required.  
Join us and let’s make Pilates magic together!

Acknowledgment:  
I understand that I am applying for a position with an employer that is an independently owned and operated The Daily Pilates® franchisee, and not the franchisor, The Daily Pilates LLC or any of its affiliates (“The Daily Pilates”). Each studio location is independently owned and may have varying perks, compensation, and employment requirements. With respect to any position with a franchisee, I understand and agree that any information I provide in this application will be submitted directly to the independent franchisee, who is solely responsible for all employment related matters in their studio, including but not limited to hiring, firing, discipline, supervision, staffing and scheduling. The Daily Pilates will not receive a copy of my application, will have no control over whether I receive an interview and/or am ultimately hired, does not control and is not responsible for the employment policies and practices of independent franchisees, and does not employ independent franchisees’ employees. If I am hired to work at an independent franchisee’s studio, the independent franchisee (and not The Daily Pilates) will be my employer. By submitting my application and resume, I am confirming that I agree and consent to the foregoing.

Specific job duties and selection requirements vary between The Daily Pilates studio locations. More information can be provided by contacting the studio’s hiring manager directly.

title: Compassionate Memory Care Companion
description:
We are urgently looking for a compassionate and experienced Companion Caregiver to join our team, specializing in Dementia and Alzheimer's care. If you have a passion for making a positive impact in the lives of others and possess the skills necessary to provide exceptional care, we would love to hear from you.

**Position Overview:**

As a Companion Caregiver, you will provide essential support and companionship to clients with Dementia and Alzheimer's, helping them maintain their quality of life in the comfort of their homes. Your role will involve offering emotional support, and ensuring the safety and well-being of our clients.

**Key Responsibilities:**

Offer companionship and engage clients in meaningful activities

Prepare and serve nutritious meals according to dietary requirements

Perform light housekeeping duties to ensure a clean and safe environment

Help with mobility and transportation to appointments and social outings

Monitor and report changes in clients' health status to the care team

Follow individualized care plans tailored to the specific needs of Dementia and Alzheimer's clients

**Qualifications**:

Proven experience as a Companion Caregiver, particularly with Dementia and Alzheimer's patients

Current Covid-19 vaccination is required

Valid driver's license and access to reliable transportation

Flexibility to work varied hours, including weekends

Strong interpersonal skills, patience, and a caring nature

**What We Offer:**

Competitive salary

Flexible work schedule

Opportunities for ongoing training and professional development

A supportive and collaborative team environment

The chance to make a real difference in the lives of those you care for

If you are dedicated, compassionate, and eager to contribute to a team that values quality care, apply today to join us as a Companion Caregiver with specialized experience in Dementia and Alzheimer's care.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Come join our growing community of Care Partners who share this common purpose! At Renewal Memory Partners, we are dedicated to providing holistic, person-centered care to people living with Alzheimer’s and related dementias. Our organization is also committed to providing affirming care to the LGBTQ community.

For all Care Partners of Renewal Memory Partners, we are proud to offer:

* **Community:** We understand that caring for older adults can be isolating at times, and we strive to build community among Care Partners through ongoing support groups, dynamic trainings, and virtual meet-ups.
* **Professional Development:** Through the Renewal Memory Institute, you will have access to best-in-class trainings offered by a multidisciplinary team of experts. You may also have the opportunity to engage in cutting-edge research studies through our partnerships with university and hospital-based teams.
* **Competitive Compensation:** At Renewal Memory Partners, we strive to offer top starting pay, plus a wide range of benefits.
* **A Person-Centered Approach that Honors You:** We celebrate both our clients and our Care Partners as diverse individuals, and actively learn about their hobbies, backgrounds, and interests. We thoughtfully match clients and Care Partners who can build genuine, authentic connections.

**Responsibilities:**

* Providing companionship to older adults and people with chronic health conditions in their homes (e.g., discussing current events, creating artwork, reviewing photo albums).
* Providing compassionate, patient hands-on personal care support for ADLs, including bathing, dressing, grooming, toileting, and transfers.
* Planning activities outside the home and accompanying clients to keep them engaged with the world (e.g., trips to museums, concerts, plays, or the park).
* Escorting clients to doctors’ appointments.
* Running errands for clients (e.g., grocery shopping, sundries).
* Reminding clients to take their medications.
* Doing light exercise with clients (e.g., helping with stretching routine).
* Assisting clients in preparing meals.
* Performing light housekeeping, such as dusting, tidying, and laundry.

**Qualifications:**

We welcome candidates with diverse backgrounds including the creative arts and healthcare fields. Our employment is selective. Strong candidates possess:

* A valid HHA certificate in New York State
* A passion for caring for individuals with Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias. Prior experience working with this population is valued, but not required.
* An accredited high school diploma, though we prefer candidates with college degrees or those currently attending colleges or graduate schools.
* Deep empathy and patience.
* Flexibility, reliability, and responsiveness.
* Creativity and a positive, open-hearted approach.
* Strong composure under pressure.
* Excellent interpersonal skills, including the ability to build trust-based relationships with clients and their families.

**Benefits:**

* Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
* $300 Referral Bonus for Care Partners and Clients
* Daily Pay – We understand your need
* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Paid Trainings
* Care Partner of the Month Awards – We celebrate you!
* 401(k) for Senior Care Partners
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* 24/7 Client Services Support
* 24/7 RN Support

title: Assistant Director of Dining Services
description:
**Job Duties:**

* Oversee the preparation and cooking of meals.
* Coordinate activities of hourly employees.
* Under the direction of the DDS, schedule and set up food preparation in accordance with menus recipes.
* Check flow of work, analyze delays and productions problems, and take corrective actions.
* Test products to ensure quality is maintained.
* Interface with others in the department to ensure resident satisfaction is met and exceeded.
* Implement and monitor facility Policies and Procedures as directed by DDS.
* Assure that the facility is following City, State, and Federal regulations.
* Implement seasonal menus for Spring/Summer and Fall/Winter.
* Ensure that all meals are nutritious, palatable, and satisfying by overseeing the preparation and serving of all meals and snacks.
* Ensure staff follow menus, spreadsheets, standardized recipes, mechanically altered diets and menu preference sheets.
* Ensure all residents are served the diet as prescribed by MD/ Dietitian.
* Organize and maintain current diet order for all residents.
* Maintain necessary Food Service records. I.e.: Menus, Spreadsheets, Recipes, all Kitchen Logs, and all Food Supplier invoices.
* Inventory and order all food and supply while staying within assigned budget.
* Responsible for participating in interviewing, hiring, scheduling, in-service training, evaluating, and terminating of all Dining Services staff.

* Assisting with the Weekly accounting form and sending it in in the absence of the DDS.
* Assisting with the administration report/maintenance log and sending it in the absence of the DDS.
* Assisting with monthly themed meals or any holiday meals with DDS and other staff members.
* Assisting in creating weekly schedules for employees in the absence of the DDS and staying within the par level hours allotted by D.O.M.
* Assist with entering employees’ schedules weekly in Excel force.
* Assist with DDS to keep kitchen clean, free of dirt and clutter and always organized.
* Assist DDS in controlling overuse or underuse of food items for 3-week cycle meals.
* Report all maintenance issues to DDS or administration as soon as notified or noticed.
* Assist DDS in making sure staff are staying on task at all times and not abusing their schedule/shift.
* Perform other duties as assigned by management.

**Required Skills/Abilities:**

* Prior experience in a similar role required.
* Great communication and interpersonal skills are a must.
* Ability to operate cooking and food preparation equipment.
* Ability to work a flexible schedule including holidays and weekends.

title: Nursing Director RN
description:
**Nursing Director RN** 

**Yonkers, NY** 

**Sunrise Senior Living was again certified as a Great Place to Work by Activated Insights. This is the 7th time Sunrise has received this top culture and workplace designation, highlighting the special place Sunrise is to be a part of.** 

**COMMUNITY NAME**

**Sunrise of Crestwood**

Job ID: 2024-215499

JOB OVERVIEW

The **Resident Care Director (RCD)/ Director of Nursing/Nursing Director** serves as the nursing clinical leader for the community and is responsible to lead and manage the health and wellness along with coordination of care and services to residents within the community. Responsible for oversight and implementation of all Care programs, regulatory compliance, recruiting, and performance management.

**RESPONSIBILITIES & QUALIFICATIONS**

**Responsibilities:**

As a part of the Sunrise team, supporting our Mission, Principles of Service and Core Values is a fundamental part of this job. Our foundational belief is the sacred value of human life. Every year, team members are assigned required training that applies to their role to ensure that these standards are always met. The unique responsibilities for this role include but are not limited to the essential functions listed below:

Managing Health and Wellness:

* Provide strategic leadership for resident care in the community by managing, directing, and monitoring the nursing team as applicable by State/Province law, to promote the health and wellness of the resident population.
* Provide clinical care through the direct application of the nursing process; perform and document resident assessments, progress notes, evaluates changes in care needs, complete Individualized Service Plans, provide or delegate hands-on clinical care as indicated by the plan of care and evaluate resident outcomes.
* Collaborates with physicians, pharmacists, and other clinical providers to coordinate care and services for the residents.
* Fulfills all required training within the required time frame, including the completion of all Sunrise University training and all training required by regulating authorities.
* Serves as the CLIA Director as applicable for the community and according to the federal and state requirements.
* Partner with Neighborhood Coordinators to promote an integrated and collaborative approach to wellness operations and resident care.
* Collaborate with Sales partners to determine community capability and assess potential residents’ appropriateness for move- in.
* Seeks direction from a Registered Nurse as needed in accordance with state regulations and nurse practice acts.

Medication Management:

* Provide strategic leadership for resident care in the community by managing, directing, and monitoring the medication care managers, as applicable by State/Province law, to promote the health and wellness of the resident population.
* Provide oversight of the community medication management program to promote resident safety in the medication use process including onboarding, training, and performance reviews.
* Fulfills all required training within the required time frame, including the completion of all Sunrise University training and all training required by regulating authorities.
* Provide clinical training and education, as needed, to nurses, medication care managers, care managers and others who provide resident care. Perform skill evaluation to assure clinical capability of care team members.

Quality Assurance and Regulatory Compliance:

* Track, trend and report clinical quality data to identify risk.
* Participate actively as a member of the community Quality Assurance and Performance Improvement committee.
* Lead clinical quality and process improvement initiatives within the community to mitigate risk and improve resident care outcomes.
* Recruit, hire and train clinical team members and is responsible for performance management, evaluations, and engagement.
* Completes direct report team member staffing and scheduling according to operational and budgetary guidelines.
* Partners with the community leadership team to promote resident safety and compliance with Risk Management and OSHA programs.
* Serves as the ICC and CLIA Director as applicable for the community.
* Responsible for infection control programming, including delegation of infection control preventionist, as per state requirements.
* Assure compliance with all Federal, State/Provincial, board of nursing and other applicable regulations.

Financial Management:

* Manages the department budget to include labor and other expenses and understands it’s impact on the community’s bottom line.
* Processes and submits monthly expenses and budget data in a timely manner, per Sunrise policies and internal business controls.
* Understands the internal costs associated with all Sunrise resident care programs.

Training, Leadership and Team Member Development:

* Partners with the Regional Director of Resident Care and/or Executive Director in the delivery and participation in Sunrise University training and self-study programs.
* On-boards new RCD leaders and other department coordinators as needed.
* Develops a working knowledge of state/provincial regulations, ensures compliance through supervising and coaching team members.
* Completes clinical team member staffing and scheduling according to operational and budgetary guidelines when assigned to a community.
* Holds clinical team accountable, corrects actions when necessary and documents.
* Attends regular meetings; Stand Up, Cross Over, Department Head Meetings, Town Hall, QAPI, and others as directed by the Executive Director.
* Keeps abreast of professional developments in the field by reading and attending conferences and training sessions.

**•** Maintains compliance in assigned required training and all training required by state/province or other regulating authorities as applicable to this role to ensure that Sunrise standards are always met.

**Qualifications:**

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed throughout this job description are representative of the knowledge, skills, and abilities required.

* Graduate of an accredited college or school of nursing with a current state license as a professional Licensed Registered Nurse (RN).
* Minimum two (2) years RN experience; at least one (1) year experience in home health, assisted living, or long-term care environment preferred.
* Minimum of one (1) year nursing management experience, including hiring, coaching, performance management, scheduling and daily operations supervision.
* Certified in CPR and First Aid.
* Demonstrated knowledge of applied nursing practices, techniques, and methods in accordance with federal, state/province and board of nursing requirements.
* Knowledge of infection control practices and prevention of disease transmission.
* Ability to delegate assignments to the appropriate individuals based on their demonstrated skill capability and in compliance with all regulations.
* Experience in tracking, trending and analysis of clinical performance data preferred.
* Experience in quality and clinical process improvement and risk assessment preferred.
* Experience in staff development, training and/or clinical education preferred.
* Proven ability to handle multiple priorities, organize efficiently, and manage time effectively.
* Demonstrated critical thinking, clinical judgment, and decision-making skills.
* Computer proficiency with electronic medical records, the Microsoft Office suite, and the ability to learn new applications.
* Ability to work weekends, evenings and flexible hours as needed for resident care/services, including 24/7 on call responsibility.

**ABOUT SUNRISE**

Sunrise Senior Living has championed quality of life in senior care for more than 30 years. We believe team members are our greatest resource and are looking for people who share our commitment to provide quality care for seniors and their families. It's no surprise that many of the world's leading experts in Senior Living entrust their career to Sunrise.

At Sunrise, you will

**Make a Difference Every Day**

We are passionate about our mission to champion quality of life for all seniors. We deliver high-quality care with a personal touch and encourage our residents to enjoy life to the fullest.

**Be Part of a Uniquely Supportive Community**

The care-focused environment we create for residents extends to our team members. We offer programs, rewards, and benefits to help you live your best.

**Ignite Your Potential**

We believe potential has no limits. We offer best-in-class leadership development programs designed to grow our leaders. We are committed to helping our team members achieve their career goals.

**Apply today to learn why Sunrise Senior Living is a certified Great Place to Work**

**PRE-EMPLOYMENT REQUIREMENTS**

Sunrise considers the health and safety of its residents, family members, and team members to be one of its highest priorities. All offers of employment with Sunrise are conditioned on completing and passing a background check and drug test (which does not include marijuana), participating in testing requirements (e.g. Tuberculosis Test, Physical Evaluation). Covid-19 and Influenza vaccination is only required to the extent mandated by applicable federal, state, and local laws and authorities.

**COMPENSATION DISCLAIMER:**

Selected candidates will be offered competitive compensation based on geographic location of community/office, skills, experience, qualifications, and certifications/licenses (where applicable).

**SEARCH FIRM REPRESENTATIVES PLEASE READ CAREFULLY:**

Sunrise Senior Living is not seeking assistance or accepting unsolicited resumes from search firms for this employment opportunity. Regardless of past practice, all resumes submitted by search firms to Sunrise Senior Living by any means, be it via email, the Internet or directly to hiring managers at Sunrise Senior Living in any form without a valid written search agreement in place for that position will be deemed the property of Sunrise Senior Living, and no fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by Sunrise Senior Living as a result of such unsolicited referral or through any other means.

Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Security Monitor - F02/F80 Certified
description:
**Position Overview:**

The Security Monitor provides overall facility monitoring and surveillance through regular facility rounds, maintains log of person entering and exiting the facility; conducts fire drills and maintains log books on fire drill and emergency apparatus. The security staff also documents accounts of resident’s non-compliance of curfews, and other rules and regulations. This position requires a minimum F02 certification. **Candidates with a F80 certification qualify for an increased hourly rate**.

**Responsibilities:**

* Maintain a log of visitors entering and exiting the premises and record all unusual incidents per established procedures, while ensuring that only authorized personnel and visitors enter the property.
* Surveillance of the grounds, facility and activities of the residents to prevent theft and resident harm.
* Ensure that all doors from the facility are locked and secured.
* Monitor fire and safety procedures.
* Provide administrative support in the area of the office coverage, telephone and clerical work.
* Perform light maintenance responsibilities in the absence of maintenance staff.

title: Psychotherapist (LPC, LAC, LCSW, LMFT, or LSW) , full time or part time
description:
**Now Hiring A Psychotherapist in Hoboken, NJ!**

Here at **Anchor Therapy**, we are an established mental health group private practice in downtown Hoboken, NJ. We are seeking a dedicated part-time or full-time psychotherapist that can contribute to our growing team. **We take care of everything so you can focus on your clients.**

At Anchor Therapy, we require evening and/or weekend hours. For part-time, there is a minimum of 15 mandatory clinical hours per week, while full-time will require a minimum of 25 clinical hours per week. We are an out-of-network practice with insurance **and have a steady stream of referrals.** The therapists at Anchor Therapy are given the opportunity to work in a supportive, fun, professional, positive, and familial work environment where employees feel appreciated and valued. We are a collaborative team that gets to work with some of the best clients that the Hoboken community has to offer. Experience with CBT clinical skills as well as children, teens, young adults, and/or couples is desired. At Anchor Therapy there is no need to worry about quarterly taxes, marketing expenses, or any other overhead costs because candidates will be **employee status**. We are the perfect place to make the switch from agency work to private practice. We make this a smooth experience for the potential candidate to learn from a supportive and experienced group owner.

**Compensation will be fee-for-service at the following rates and is paid out biweekly:**

* $100/ 60 minute intake session/ couples counseling or family session
* $70/ 45 minute individual therapy session
* *Provisionally Licensed Therapists (LAC, LSW ) will be paid out at a lower rate based on their experience.*

**We provide:**

* Full medical benefits (including dental and vision) for full-time employees
* 401K (with 3% employer automatic contribution)
* Steady stream of referrals
* Highly competitive pay and benefits
* Intake coordination, including screening and scheduling of new clients
* Individual consultation
* Biweekly group case consultation
* Weekly supervision for provisionally licensed therapists (LAC, LSW)
* Paid sick time
* Paid administrative time
* Other health benefits (disability, hospital, accident, cancer coverage, and life insurance)
* Team support
* Professional trainings
* Beautifully decorated and calming office suite in the best location in Hoboken (right across from the Hoboken Path train station, bus station, and NY ferry - with NYC views!)
* Unlimited coffee bar with snacks
* Electronic health records
* Marketing
* Billing services
* Growth opportunity
* Flexible scheduling, including ability to work remotely
* HIPAA-compliant professional e-mail
* Fun team outings

**Minimum Requirements are:**

* Current State of New Jersey license as a **LCSW, LPC, LMFT, LSW, LAC, PsyD, or PhD**
* Mandatory 15 clinical hours minimum per week
* Available to work nights and/or weekends
* 2 years of counseling experience

**Required education:**

* Master's or Doctorate

**Required license:**

* LCSW, LPC, LMFT, LSW, LAC, PsyD, or PhD

**Equal Opportunity Employer:**

* Anchor Therapy values a diverse workplace and strongly encourages and welcomes all people of color, LGBTQIA+ individuals, and members of ethnic minorities to apply.

**For consideration, applicants must:**

* Send resume and cover letter to Courtney Glashow (email can be found on Anchor Therapy website)
* Complete our employment questionnaire on our Anchor Therapy website: anchortherapy.org/careers-counseling-job-position

Applicants who complete the requirements and match our needs will be contacted for a phone screening before an in person interview.

title: Litigation Associate Attorney with 3-5 Years of Experience
description:
Dunnington, Bartholow & Miller LLP is a growing midsize Park Avenue law firm founded in 1921 with an international focus seeking a Litigation Associate with at least 3-5 years of experience. The ideal candidate is a team player with excellent writing skills who understands that superior client service and satisfaction are the keys to success. They must also possess the ability to lead a litigation team and support litigation partners. The ideal candidate will also have the opportunity to work with partners across multiple practice groups, including Intellectual Property, Advertising, Art and Fashion Law, Privacy and Cybersecurity, and our White Collar Defense and Investigations group, just to name a few.

Federal or state judicial clerkship and foreign-language skills are a plus but not required.

**JOB TYPE:** Full-time; Currently, our Associates are in the office three days and remote two days weekly.

JOB LOCATION: New York, NY

EDUCATION: Juris Doctorate from an ABA-accredited law school

EXPERIENCE:

* NY bar admission or the ability to waive into the NY bar
* Commercial Litigation, 3-5 years

SALARY: $120, 000 to $145,000

TO APPLY: All candidates who meet the criteria should apply through their school’s recruiting platform. If there’s an issue that your school has not resolved, then you may send your resume, cover letter, writing sample, and references to tcarter[at]dunnington.com.

NOTABLE BENEFITS:

* Monthly professional individual coaching.
* 12 vacation days plus ten personal days, which increases to 20 vacation days and ten personal days after one year of employment.
* Health, Dental, Vision, and Life insurance.

WHO WE ARE:

Founded in 1921, Dunnington, Bartholow & Miller LLP is a growing New York City-based international firm that maintains its core values of reliability, trustworthiness, and commitment to excellence. Dunnington provides a full array of legal services, including counsel in Corporate, Litigation, Employment, Trust & Estates, Intellectual Property (with Fashion and Art law), Real Estate, Immigration, and Not-for-Profit practice areas. The Firm is organized into practice teams focused on Italy, France, Latin America, the United Kingdom/Commonwealth and is a member of the Cicero League of International Lawyers.

As the Firm celebrated its centennial in 2021, we are dedicated to providing clients with a personalized approach for an efficient, cost-effective way to tackle the problems at hand. Dunnington, Bartholow & Miller LLP is a signatory to the New York City Bar’s Statement of Diversity Principles and believes that through increased diversity, the legal profession can more effectively address societal and individual needs by bringing to bear more varied perspectives, experiences, and knowledge to the practice of law.

EEO STATEMENT:

Dunnington, Bartholow & Miller is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, gender, sexual orientation, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: RN Visiting Nurse - New Grads Welcome!
description:
**Large Licensed Home Care Agency (LHCSA) is seeking an RN to see patients in** the Bronx **only!**

**Great opportunity for RN who enjoys the flexibility of being in the field.** 

**Salary is open based on experience + excellent health benefits, PTO and 401k.** 

**Responsibilities:**

* Initial assessments, reassessments and supervision of HHAs
* Assesses the patient/family situation for nursing and health related problems.
* Provides nursing care to patients requiring part time or intermittent professional nursing care at home.
* Develops and coordinates the plan of care specific to the needs of individual patients in conjunction with all health team members.
* Instructs and supervise patients, caregivers, LPNs, and home health aides in aspects of patient care as appropriate.
* Reports significant conditions/symptoms to the patient’s physician and modifies the plan of care accordingly.
* Initiates appropriate preventive and rehabilitative nursing procedures.
* Educates the patient/family regarding the disease process, self care techniques and prevention strategies.
* Evaluates the effectiveness and outcomes of care.
* Consults with and refers to other professionals or agencies in the community concerning patient needs
* Interprets to patient/families Agency policies, procedures and federal/state/local laws and regulations affecting service or entitlements.
* Documents, on a timely basis, all nursing service provided to patients as well as periodic reports to coordinate care and remain in compliance with state/federal regulations.
* Systematically plans for discharge from service.
* Effectively manages document flow and confidentiality of patient records as per Agency policy.
* Demonstrates a knowledge of and adherence to agency policy as well as state/federal regulations governing home care service.
* Participates in program evaluation, research, educational programs and other agency activities as appropriate.
* Maintains sufficient service productivity to meet agency goals and objectives.
* Participates in activities to enhance professional growth.
* Participates in the orientation of new staff.
* Participates in the student nurse program as assigned.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

**Qualifications:**

* License and current registration to practice as a Registered Professional Nurse in the State of New York.
* Minimum of 1 to 2 years experience as a registered nurse in either Medical/Surgical nursing or home care
* Ability to assess and respond to the needs of patients and families in the home setting.
* Professional Liability Insurance
* Able to drive with automobile in good working order and available for use in the field.
* Ability to master basic computer skills.
