o Reception and hospitality tasks: Duties may include answering and forwarding calls, scheduling conference rooms through Outlook, communicating with customers via Outlook, Microsoft TEAMS, Zoom, and in-person, greeting visitors, assisting with stocking kitchen supplies, maintaining cleanliness and organization of kitchen areas, conference room set up/take down, other office-related tasks.

o Employees may be re-assigned to another site in the morning or in the middle of the day.

o Shift hours may vary depending on location: 7am – 4pm, 8am – 5pm, 9am – 6pm. Overtime may be required occasionally. Work week – Mon – Fri. Candidates should be available for work between 7am and 7pm.

**JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

* An integral member of the service team supporting the daily operations for all contracted services at customer accounts within a geographical area
* Provides coverage for absences or vacations of the onsite resources, that may also include site management.
* May be required to report to an alternate site on any given day which could result in walking, driving, or using public transportation to that alternate site and a longer commute time that exceeds scheduled shift
* Assists management with process improvement, procedural testing and validation and ensuring field compliance with operational best practices.
* Support the Field Implementation Managers with the implementation of new customer accounts and service expansions.
* Assists with onboarding new team members and cross training peers
* Assists with the development of Site Procedure Guides and sharing best practices throughout geographical area.
* Routinely inspects Site Procedures Guide at various locations for accuracy and compliance
* Performs daily visual inspection of site services and Client and customer compliancy to safety.
* Creates and maintains a customer-focused environment.
* Responsible for escalating customer issues to Client Management and supporting the resolution to completion.
* Communicates effectively and responds quickly to customer and end user communication
* When applicable, must maintain and accurately submit monthly expenses in a timely manner following proper coding requirements.
* Performs other duties as assigned

**Minimum Qualifications**

**QUALIFICATIONS (EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, CERTIFICATIONS)**

* Requires high school diploma plus 12 months of related work experience. Post High School education encouraged and preferred
* Requires intermediate skill level on Microsoft 365 applications, communication tools (Microsoft TEAMS, Zoom, Webex), and folder management and navigating to network production folders.
* Mailroom operations, reception, hospitality, print production experience is preferred

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

All candidates must possess the following abilities and skills:

* Work in a team environment by maintaining positive, productive relationships with co-workers.
* Work well with or without supervision.
* Adapt to changing situations, flexibility, high motivation, and sense of urgency.
* Basic math skills.
* Make sound justifiable decisions and take action in solving problems.
* Perform repetitive work by continuously executing different tasks according to set procedures, sequence or pace while maintaining quality and output standards.
* Commitment to task by having started and persisted with specific courses of action.
* Excellent oral communication skills by being able to clearly present information through the spoken word in positive and negative circumstances.
* Comprehend written and verbal instructions from customers and effectively translate to site resources
* Resolve customer related issues.
* Troubleshoot and coordinate problem resolution.

**WORKING CONDITIONS, MENTAL AND PHYSICAL DEMANDS**

* Typically, an office or warehouse environment with adequate lighting and ventilation, and a normal range of temperature and noise level
* Work assignments are diversified. It is required to interpret, comprehend, and apply complex material, data and instruction; prepare, provide and convey diversified information
* Working conditions regularly expose individuals to conditions that could result in minor cuts
* Some physical effort is required which may involve long periods of standing, walking, bending, reaching, stretching, climbing or similar activities as well as lifting or moving items weighing up to 50 lbs. and in pushing or pulling machines on wheels, which may weigh up to 400 lbs., in order to move for repairs. Walking between buildings may be necessary.
* Moderate dexterity - regular application of basic skills (calculator, keyboard, hand tools, eye/hand coordination).
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision
* While most assignment hours are 8-5 Monday through Friday, schedule flexibility is required. Some sites may open at 6AM and some may not close until 7PM or later with other locations that are open on the weekend and other times may vary.

title: Maintenance Manager
description:
**Job Title: Maintenance Manager**

Job Summary:

As a Maintenance Manager, you are responsible for overseeing the maintenance operations of residential properties. You will lead a team of maintenance technicians, ensuring that properties are well-maintained, safe, and in compliance with regulations. Your role involves managing maintenance schedules, coordinating repairs, and ensuring timely resolution of maintenance issues to uphold property value and resident satisfaction.

Responsibilities:

Maintenance Operations Management:

- Develop and implement maintenance plans and schedules for routine inspections, preventive maintenance, and repairs.

- Coordinate and prioritize maintenance tasks to ensure timely completion and efficient use of resources.

- Conduct regular inspections of properties to assess maintenance needs, identify issues, and ensure compliance with safety standards and regulations.

Team Leadership and Supervision:

- Recruit, train, and supervise maintenance technicians, ensuring they have the skills, resources, and support needed to perform their duties effectively.

- Delegate maintenance tasks and responsibilities to maintenance staff, providing guidance and feedback as needed.

- Foster a positive and collaborative work environment, promoting teamwork, accountability, and continuous improvement among maintenance staff.

Vendor and Contractor Management:

- Oversee relationships with external vendors, contractors, and service providers, including negotiating contracts and ensuring quality of work.

- Obtain bids and proposals for maintenance projects, evaluate vendor performance, and ensure compliance with contractual agreements.

- Coordinate with vendors and contractors to schedule and oversee repairs, renovations, and capital improvement projects.

Budgeting and Cost Management:

- Develop and manage maintenance budgets, forecasting expenses, and identifying cost-saving opportunities.

- Monitor maintenance expenses, review invoices, and ensure accurate accounting and budgetary compliance.

- Identify long-term maintenance needs and assist in planning and budgeting for capital expenditures.

Resident Relations and Customer Service:

- Respond promptly to maintenance requests and emergencies from residents, ensuring timely resolution of issues and minimizing disruption.

- Maintain open communication with residents regarding maintenance activities, schedules, and progress updates.

- Address resident concerns and complaints related to maintenance issues, providing exemplary customer service and fostering positive resident relations.

Documentation and Reporting:

- Maintain organized records of maintenance activities, work orders, repairs, and equipment inventory.

- Prepare regular reports on maintenance performance, including maintenance expenses, work order completion rates, and tenant satisfaction.

Qualifications:

- Bachelor's degree in facilities management, engineering, construction management, or related field preferred.

- 4 or more years of experience in maintenance management, facilities management, or related field, with supervisory experience preferred.

- Strong knowledge of building systems, construction methods, and maintenance best practices.

- Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to motivate and manage a diverse team.

- Solid understanding of budgeting, cost control, and financial management principles.

- Proficiency in computerized maintenance management systems (Yardi) and other relevant software.

- Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities, with a focus on customer service and tenant satisfaction.

- Valid driver's license and reliable transportation may be required.

Additional Requirements:

- Willingness to work flexible hours, including evenings, weekends, and on-call duties, as needed.

- Ability to prioritize tasks, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and work effectively under pressure.

- Certification in maintenance management (e.g., Certified Maintenance Manager) a plus.

title: Financial Representative
description:
Financial Representative

Strategies for Wealth: 437 Madison Ave, NY and 800 Westchester Ave, Rye Brook, NY

Overview

Our Financial Representatives and Advisors act as advocates for clients and are committed to continually enhance, enrich, and serve their community. They problem-solve for their clients, researching and proposing educated financial strategies which leads to long-lasting, value-based client relationships. As a Financial Advisor with [Firm Name] you will gather, manage and service a book of investment-oriented clients by identifying and acquiring assets and developing additional business through referrals.

We take an uncommon approach to financial services, focusing on long‐term results and leveraging technology, exceptional relationship management and customized strategies to consumers and businesses.

It’s time to put yourself and your clients first. We’re looking to add new advisors to our team who share our passion and values.

You are…

· Passionate with a desire to help others and make a positive impact in your community.

title: Benefits, Compensation & HRIS Specialist
description:
**Salary: $85,000 - $90,000 Annually**  

  

The YMCA of Greater New York is here for all New Yorkers — to empower youth, improve health, and strengthen community. Founded in 1852, today the Y serves a diverse population of more than half a million New Yorkers who learn, grow, and thrive through programs and services at our 24 branches. Community is the cornerstone of the Y. Together, we connect active, engaged New Yorkers to build stronger communities.  

  

To help fulfill our mission, we cultivate a culture of learning, leading, and collaboration to enhance community impact. Through our talented staff and “LEAP” career framework (Leadership, Empowerment, Accountability, Personal Growth), we are committed to a people-first approach that fosters trust, inclusion, growth, and development for all.  

  

The YMCA of Greater New York Association Office is seeking a Benefit, Compensation & HRIS Specialist, who will provide solid analytical, technical, administrative and customer service support Associate-wide ensuring accurate processing, timely crisis resolution, various report creation/generation, and regulatory compliance. This role will serve as the primary contact for all benefit and compensation administration inquiries, report requests, as well as be responsible for CONNECT:HR and Advanced Benefits.  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Responsible for the CONNECT system, provides guidance to all branch HR Coordinators and AO staff on the Human Resources and Advanced Benefit modules. This includes report creation and generation (ad hoc), ongoing procedural guide creation/updating, various element testing (both HR and Payroll) and implementation.
* Primary contact for all health and welfare plan administration/guidance. Subject matter expert regarding the Affordable Care Act (ACA).
* Responsible for customization and management of file interfaces with vendors and insurance carriers, ensuring accurate plan enrollments, reconciliations, and timely COBRA notifications.
* Assist Retirees and COBRA participants with various benefit plan inquiries.
* Serve as primary contact for all staff members regarding Leave requests (FMLA, Disability, Personal, etc.) which includes maintaining, tracking, and managing the Disability/Leave files/records.
* Assist in the management of the annual Open Enrollment process, which includes creating and distributing communications, and creating, testing, and implementing changes in CONNECT.
* Assist in the administration of the Salary Administration Plan which includes assisting with grading all Association positions, answering various compensation questions, and assisting in the annual exempt and non-exempt performance appraisal process. In addition, this position will assist in the Performance Plan process (Cornerstone administration).
* Administration of the Incentive Pay program which includes monitoring eligibility, employee communications and ensuring payments are processed timely and accurately.
* Responsible for management of PTO accruals in CONNECT. This includes providing guidance to all staff on employee eligibility and proper calculations.
* Work on special projects as requested by management and/or various departments.

 **Desired Skills & Experience:**

* Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent work experience.
* Minimum of three (3) years of solid Human Resources experience with strong knowledge of benefit and compensation plan administration and ERISA/FLSA/Department of Labor regulations.
* ERISA, FLSA, Affordable Care Act (ACA), vendor negotiations, and various benefit plan designs.
* Knowledge of HRIS.
* Knowledge and experience of providing strong customer service is a must.
* PHR or SPHR designation desired but not essential.

 **Benefits:**  

The YMCA of Greater New York offers a variety of benefits to its staff members including retirement benefits, medical, paid time off, free YMCA membership and more! Benefit eligibility is determined by an individual’s employment status (i.e., full-time or part-time), tenure and/or the number of hours scheduled to work. Click here for more information.  

  

**How to Apply:**  

If you would like to be a member of our dynamic team, please complete our online application and submit your résumé and a thoughtful cover letter that explains your interest in the role and our organization.  

  

If you are a current YMCA employee, please submit your application through the Internal Career Site in Cornerstone.

title: Security Officer (Morning Shift)
description:
**Security Officer– QPS**

**Job Description**

QPS Security Officer is responsible to ensure the safety of staff and visitors in primarily class “A” office buildings, positions are also available in retail and residential buildings. Monitor access control systems including turnstiles, cameras, loading dock. Screen visitors, guests, contractors and delivery personnel and issue passes to authorized individuals. Prepare incident reports and escalate serious issues to manager(s) as per protocol. Provide direction and assistance to building occupants during emergency incidents.

**Schedules Available:**

* ***Tues-Sat 9am-5pm = 40 hours***
* ***Mon-Fri 7am-3pm = 40 hours***
* ***Thurs-Fri 7am-3pm/Sat-Sun 7am-7pm = 40 hours***

**Job Requirements:** 

* 3 - 5 years security experience preferred
* Professional appearance, demeanor and strong customer service skills
* Must be flexible to work all shifts including weekends, holidays and overtime as needed
* Proficient written and verbal communication skills
* Veterans with an honorable discharge are strongly encouraged to apply

**License:**

* New York State Security Guard License (Required)
* 8-hour annual Security Officer refresher - current (Required)
* 16-hour on the job training certificate – (Required)
* Fire Guard for Impairment F-01 (Preferred), must be obtained within 2 weeks of employment
* First Aid / AED – CPR certification (Preferred)

**Availability**

QPS maintains operations 24/7/365 and is an “essential business” in the New York area. We work during normal times as well as when other businesses may be closed down. The position requires flexibility and an ability to work whatever schedule and hours are deemed necessary to efficiently accomplish the work and service our clients, which may include working extended hours, weekends, holidays, and/or during emergency situations, such as natural disasters (storms, including but not limited to rain, wind, snow and ice, floods, power outages, fires, earthquakes, etc.), public health emergencies such as the COVID-19 pandemic, government-declared states of emergency, labor strikes, and force majeure events. Accessibility to answer questions by email or phone during off hours in accordance with QPS’ policies is expected. The ability to work this schedule is an essential function of the job.

*Quality Protection Services is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.*

description:
**Prime Healthcare** is an award-winning health system headquartered in Ontario, California. Prime Healthcare operates 45 hospitals and has more than 300 outpatient locations in 14 states providing more than 2.6 million patient visits annually. It is one of the nation’s leading health systems with nearly 50,000 employees and physicians. Fourteen of the Prime Healthcare hospitals are members of the Prime Healthcare Foundation, a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit public charity. Prime Healthcare is actively seeking new members to join our corporate team!

We are seeking a detail-oriented Revenue Cycle Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in medical billing, coding, and terminology to ensure accurate and timely processing of healthcare claims.

title: Floral Team Lead
description:
**Floral Team Lead**

**Job Type:** Full-time / Part-time

**About Us -**

We believe in surrounding ourselves with practiced individuals as well as budding talent – We believe in surrounding ourselves with practiced individuals as well as budding talent – creating a supportive team environment where imagination has no bounds and we can exercise our expertise, cultivate passion, continuously learn, and consistently thrive. We believe in fostering creativity and demystifying the intimidation of flowers through education and experience. Above all, we take pride in every petal.

Damselfly Global is a company encompassing three different business platforms.

* Damselfly Designs is our floral and event design company.
* Damselfly Flowers are our brick and mortar, retail, full service and kiosk shops
* Damselfly Direct is our ecommerce platform that supports our shops through our own website, Etsy, Minted and Crayola Flowers brand.

As a team we celebrate our journey of working with multiple Fortune 500 companies, fostering relationships from CEOS to sales associates that have helped shape our success. It’s not about where we’ve been, it’s about where we’re going and we’d love to invite you to be part of the ride.

**About you -**

We are seeking a Floral Team Lead who will be responsible for supervising and independently leading a team of sales associates to ensure exceptional customer service, sales performance, and operational efficiency. This position plays a crucial role in driving sales, maintaining store standards, and fostering a positive work environment.

**Responsibilities:**

* Communicate regularly with store management and collaborate with other shops to enhance store operations and achieve company goals as needed

**Requirements:**

title: ABA Instructor
description:
The Brooklyn Autism Center is a not-for-profit school for children with Autism that utilizes the principles of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA).

We are currently hiring for a full-time ABA Behavioral Instructor position.

**This position is ideal for entry level candidates and college grads who are, looking to enter the field of Applied Behavior Analysis, and receive quality, hands-on training with individuals with autism.**

**Responsibilities:**

Instructors are responsible for teaching students one-on-one applied behavior analysis utilizing various evidence-based methods including but not limited to discrete trial training, behavior chaining procedures, incidental teaching, implementing behavior plans, recording and graphing data, creating and maintaining stimuli and other duties as needed.

Instructors assist in the implementation of programming in a range of areas including: peer integration, social interaction, communication, academics, self-help skills, gross-motor skills, language, functional living skills, behaviors management and recreation/leisure pre-vocational skills.

Instructors assist in the implementation of data collection systems which measure student progress in each of the above areas. They participate in clinic (parent/teacher) meetings to review student progress, programs, procedures, teaching techniques, administrative matters, etc.

The Instructor is responsible for ensuring the programmatic quality and integrity of all assigned activities.

The Instructor will be responsible for working as a team member for the benefit of the participant and the program.

The Instructor will report directly to a Classroom Supervisor and Associate Clinical Director.

Instructors must attend all staff meetings and required trainings.

**Qualifications:**

Minimum Requirements: BA/BS in Psychology, Education or related field; 1 year in an ABA program preferred, but not required.

Experience working with children with Autism utilizing ABA preferred, but not required.

The Instructor should be a dynamic individual who will work with the program team to deliver and ensure smooth and efficient programming.

This person must be detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills.

The successful applicant will be motivated, energetic and reliable, with a passion for teaching children with Autism.

The Instructor understands that all conduct must reflect the highest level of professionalism.

This position is FULL TIME with hours 8:30-4:30, M-F. Excellent benefit package, including approx. 10 weeks paid vacation annually, health and dental insurance, and optional Transitchek enrollment.

**Company Description**  

Digitas Health is the *Agency of Now*: the first global connected-health agency, purpose-built for marketing today. Digitas Health specializes in helping health brands navigate a complex and shifting media environment to create deeper, more relevant connections with their consumer and professional customers. With offices in Philadelphia, New York, San Francisco, and London, it is a member of the world's largest healthcare communications network, Publicis Health. As a member of this elite network, Digitas Health is also a member of the Paris-based Publicis Groupe S.A. (Euronext Paris: FR0000130577), the world's third-largest communications group, second-largest media counsel and buying group, and a leader in digital communications.


Web: www.digitashealth.com | Facebook: www.facebook.com/digitashealth | Twitter: www.twitter.com/digitas\\_health

 **Job Description**  

The Digitas Health Account Planning team uncovers breakthrough customer insights, and helps our teams to turn them into big creative marketing ideas. Planning is part of the creative organization (and tightly integrated with creative). You will report to the SVP/Head of Planning.


The ideal Vice President/Group Director candidate has at least 10 years' experience applying new customer insight in a marketing, creative agency or professional services firm. Most importantly, we are looking for candidates with enthusiasm for pushing the frontier of how marketing can evolve to meet the needs of an ever more powerful consumer.

**Detailed Description**


The VP/Group Director is the customer insight "lead" for designated Digitas Health clients, with 3 primary responsibilities:

* Use customer insight to help the team come up with great creative marketing ideas
* Identify high impact opportunities for developing new customer insight
* Create approaches for coming up with customer insight

**Additional responsibilities:**

* Determine where and how in-depth insight about the consumer's attitude and behavior can help make our clients' marketing more successful and where the opportunities are
* Identify customer insights from existing client/Digitas Health data and translating them into relevant marketing program implications
* Apply innovative research and "listening" methodologies to create relevant customer insights
* Partner with our primary researchers, internal analysis group and client data/research organizations to maximize their work's customer insight and marketing program application value
* Improve the impact of customer insight in the creative/program development process by inspiring and partnering with creatives on your team
* Apply the Digitas Health approach to marketing program development, and inspiring your teams to embrace a "pull" approach to marketing
* Lead team brainstorms that produce fresh insight and maximize team contributions
* Create demand for account planning's contributions by demonstrating its impact
* Manage 2 mid-level planners

  

**Qualifications**  

* At least 10 years' experience working in marketing or strategic services organizations
* Qualitative research experience applying qualitative research techniques
* Familiarity with interpreting and applying quantitative research
* Undergraduate degree
* Graduate degree
* Familiar with segmentation, analytics and media research tools
* Understand what makes consumers "tick"
* Discern the customer insight and "human truth" from mounds of data
* A passion and empathy for the consumer's perspective
* Passionate about applying modern qualitative methodology to the development of insight
* Experience applying insight to marketing program development and helping the creative team translate it into creative magic
* You can quickly gain the trust of clients and internal team members at all levels
* Web experience (and passion!)
* Build demand for account planning
* Experience bringing account planning to clients and teams who haven't used it before

  

**Additional Information**  

Publicis Health is the premier global health and wellness communications network. We are one of the four solutions hubs of Publicis Groupe, the third-largest advertising and media company in the world, giving us unparalleled global reach. We manage top-tier agencies specializing in promoting innovative solutions in advertising, medical education, clinical trial program development, sales and marketing, digital, market access, and medical and scientific affairs. Our nearly 6,500 employees work at 15 agency brands across 60 offices located in 10 countries. We are a connected solutions hub, equipped for continual business transformation in today's world. We integrate services across our global offices and brands to deliver on our clients' needs. Each of our agencies brings a unique approach to business, which makes us even stronger together. We understand the rapidly changing healthcare environment and leverage it to maximize the potential of our clients' brands.


Web: www.publicishealth.com |Facebook: www.facebook.com/publicishealth Twitter: www.twitter.com/PublicisHealth/


Not all applicants will be contacted. PHCG is an equal opportunity employer.


No vendor/agency solicitation please. 24-9455 #LI-Hybrid

Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off. The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will be 10/23/2024.

title: Inventory Handler and Material Mover
description:
**About Rosco Vision**

Rosco Vision engineers and manufactures visual safety systems for all types of commercial fleet vehicles and is one of the largest suppliers of backup camera systems, mirrors, visors, and other visual safety solutions in the nation. The truck and van industries know Rosco through the exceptional products we provide to companies like Paccar, Mack, Morgan Olson, Oshkosh, and Utilimaster, all of whom manufacture vehicles for such notable fleets as UPS, Federal Express, United States Postal Service, and the Canada Post.

For over a century, Rosco’s vision has been to develop high quality products that function flawlessly for the life of the vehicle and provide a level of service and support that our customers have come to expect. We value our employees and are proud to say that many have been with the company for over ten years. We are also centrally located and a mere two blocks from the Jamaica train station, bus hubs and Long Island Railroad.

**Position Summary**

We are seeking a dedicated, career-driven professional to join our team in the role of Inventory Handler and Material Mover. The processes in the department include data entry and maintaining efficient inventory records in order to provide regular cycle counts. The ideal candidate will ensure orderly production and distribution of products by pulling orders from inventory, delivering production materials and supplies where needed and complete accuracy of inventory at all times. The Inventory Handler and Material Mover will maintain inventory by identifying, labeling, and keeping materials and supplies in stock, recording location of inventory, and reporting shortages.

Come work in a positive and supportive environment where you’ll find great opportunities for career development. Our team members are the reason for our success!

**Primary Responsibilities**

· Implement and maintain systems for efficient material handling and storage.

· Operates forklifts, hand truck, pallet jacks, and other machinery to move materials onto and off trucks.

· Locates materials and supplies by pulling and verifying materials and supplies listed on production orders

· Experience in receiving, inventory control, counting materials, and stocking materials.

· Prepares finished materials for shipment by identifying, pulling, packing, crating, stocking, loading, and securing product.

· Collaborate with cross-functional teams to resolve any material-related issues or discrepancies.

· Accountable for overall organization and cleanliness of the storeroom.

**Education Requirements and Skills**

· Education or years of related experience: Minimum of 2 years.

· Proficiency with: Basic computers skills, using Microsoft Office and Excel.

· Proficiency with: Data entry.

· Proficiency with the following software systems: CRM software such as Epicor.

· Strong knowledge of inventory control principles and practices.

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

· Excellent organizational and time management skills, with a proven ability to meet deadlines.

· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

· Excellent problem-solving and analytical thinking abilities.

· Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate when appropriate.

**Physical Requirements:**

☒ Prolonged periods of standing or walking.

☒ Must be able to lift up to 60pounds at a time.

☒ Must be able to access and navigate all areas of the facility.

☒Must be able to quickly traverse manufacturing areas.

☒ Must be able to stand, bend, squat, kneel, reach overhead, push, pull walk and stand for a long periods of time.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Paid time off
* Retirement plan

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Application Question(s):

* Do you have basic computer skills for data entry?

Experience:

* product handling and distribution: 2 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Jamaica, NY 11435 (Required)

title: LCSW/ LMSW/ LMFT/ LMHC
description:
If you meet the following criteria, we would love to meet you!

* **Good natured, non judgmental, missional team player**
* **Your** insight **helps you assist client in recognizing patterns**
* **You integrate insight, professionalism, and integrity both with clients and across team relationships**
* **You demonstrate humility by being coachable, teachable and taking ownership.**
* **Your emotional intelligence is not based solely from education, but has also been refined through your commitment to your own personal development.**
* **You are capable of working for the greater good, by being supportive of clinicians and clients.**
* **You are warm and good natured with a good work ethic**
* **You do not have your own private practice and prefer to work in a collaborative environment.**
* **You have experience working with clients directly one on one and in variety of groups settings**
* **You live in the solution**

-------  
Lager Counseling Services is currently expanding our clinical team! We are looking to hire a Clinical Psychotherapist to work with our excellent team of clinicians.

**Part time or full time openings for the right candidate.**

**PLEASE BE SURE TO ANSWER THE PHONE INTERVIEW.**

Eligible candidates should have proficiency/experience in some or all of the following:

* Family Systems ( couples and family therapy)
* Eating Disorders
* ACOA
* Gambiling
* Anxiety
* Depression
* Anger Management
* Co-Dependency
* 12 Step Recovery
* Psychopharmacology basic knowledge
* DSM V-R
* Inner child core beliefs
* Counter Transference
* Connecting beyond externals and reactive states

----

More About Us:

Lager Counseling Services is a group practice that has been in operation for over 30 years. It continues to grow and thrive. We are a group of down to earth professionals who provide a warm and accepting environment for one another and the clients we serve.

We believe that a good clinician is **insightful** and is able to hear the client on many levels while assisting the client in consistent growth and life improvement. It is our philosophy that anyone can change *if willing.*

As a practice standard, we work with our clients *strengths. Our Highest standard is the engagement and relationship with each client we serve.*

The right candidate for this job is an insightful, warm, and skilled clinician who views the people we serve as ***people and not projects***. We are primarily looking for a certain kind of person. Skill and insight are important, however, we value our culture above all.

The right candidate will be a person who:

* Lives in the solution not the problem
* Maintains a high level of emotional insight
* Is Emotionally Sober themselves
* Goes the extra mile ~ a strong work ethic
* Loves their work
* Authentic
* Team player
* Teachable- A life time learner
* A clinician who never perceives themselves as *better than* the client or other colleagues
* Committed to their own self development
* Has their own personal growth experience
* A professional with experience with family counseling, marriage counseling, addictions and ACOA insights. We will welcome someone with life experience and those who have overcome their own struggles making them better equipped in this area of treatment.
* Believes ANYONE can change
* Non-judgmental ~ **DOES NOT GOSSIP OR COMPLAIN** but resolves
* Capable of utilizing EMR systems for documentation and familiarity with Zoom for virtual sessions

**W-2 Pay structure.**

We provide the opportunity for training in cutting edge areas of clinical treatment. In service training, seminars, conferences are offered and expected of our clinicians. We are looking for highly skilled employees who are down to earth and exude caring and warm and excellent nature towards life. We are like a family of professionals who support each others growth and development. We laugh together and provide a fun and lighthearted professional environment. We approach all cases with a positive perspective and believe in excellent outcomes.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $77,061.00 per year

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance

* Please tell us 3-5 core values or personal standards that you live by

* Describe a situation you had with a client that was resistant and how you navigated that
* What would make you happiest in a work setting?

title: Culinary Instructor - Eataly Flatiron
description:
**Company Description**

Eataly is the world’s largest artisanal Italian food and beverage marketplace! Eataly is not a chain; each Eataly is different, with its own character and own theme – but all with the same aim... for our guests to:

* EAT authentic Italian food at our restaurants, cafés and to-go counters
* SHOP a selection of high-quality Italian, local and homemade products
* LEARN through our classes and our team’s product knowledge

**Job Description**

The Culinary Instructor is known as an Education and Events Lead and is a food enthusiast who passionately engages guests in Eataly’s mission through events and educational programming. Reports to the Marketing Manager.

* Plans, schedules and executes public and private events including: specialized cooking/wine/food knowledge classes, group reservations, buyouts, press events, tastings and private receptions
* Teaches a wide variety of demonstration and hands-on classes for private and public groups
* Prepares, demonstrates and executes all menu items for La Scuola; most items are savory, but occasionally sweet items will need to be executed
* Oversees kitchen mise-en-place of all stations and the cleanliness of the La Scuola kitchen
* Supervises the production of food items for events in collaboration with back-of-the-house personnel: apportions meats, vegetables and desserts, and utilizes food surpluses to control food costs
* Supervises staff members during events to ensure smooth execution
* Writes and monitors class descriptions; compiles instructor biographies, Banquet Event Orders (BEO’s) and sales contracts; creates class registration pages online
* Purchases or submits requisitions for food items, kitchen supplies and equipment
* Fosters accountability in departments and interdepartmental collaboration when planning events
* Builds and manages client lists and relationships
* Performs other duties as required or assigned

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s Degree
* 3+ years of experience in restaurant operations, sales management, marketing or event planning
* Excellent organizational, project management and time management skills
* Outstanding professional communication and editorial skills
* Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office
* Knowledge of Italian wine and gastronomy
* Proficiency in Italian language preferred

**Job Requirements**

* Availability to work onsite with a flexible schedule often including evenings, weekends and holidays

**Compensation:** This position starts at a base range of $22-$25 per hour.

Additional information

title: Associate Content Writer & Editor
description:
We are looking for is tailor-made for a native creative chameleon who excels in both written and video content, capable of generating impactful content for diverse needs. From email marketing blasts and punchy PPC ads to distilling long-form video testimonials into engaging short-form content. This position demands a unique blend of editorial insight, storytelling finesse, and strategic thinking to leverage existing content and guide creators towards producing native content that resonates deeply with audiences.


The US base salary range for this full-time position is $70,000 - $75,000. Our salary is to be determined by multiple factors including but not limited to relevant experience, knowledge, skills, locations and other job-related qualifications, and alignment with market data. In addition to salary, this position may be eligible for commissions, bonus, equity and benefits.

**This is a full-time hybrid position and requires candidates to work from Fiverr's office 3 times a week.**

  

  

Requirements:
  

* Up to 3 years of experience in content writing, copywriting and video content, with a strong portfolio demonstrating versatility across these disciplines.
* Must have proven experience in creating content for B2B audiences and writing for SaaS products
* Exceptional ability in short-form and long-form content creation, with a talent for distilling complex ideas into concise, impactful narratives.
* Editorial background with an adept understanding of how to shape content that aligns with brand identity and audience expectations.
* Strong project management skills, capable of leading content projects from conception through execution across multiple departments.
* Creative and strategic thinking skills.

  


What am I going to do?:
  

* Develop and execute content strategies that include a mix of written and video content, ensuring they align with our brand voice and business objectives.
* Craft and refine written content across a spectrum of needs, including email marketing, PPC campaigns, social media, and blogs, ensuring alignment with the brand’s voice and goals.
* Develop & script video content for content creator partners & influencers, to ensure the production of native, editorial-type content that seamlessly incorporates the brand story.
* Transforming long-form narratives such as content creator collaboration videos and customer testimonials into engaging short-form videos for PPC and other platforms.
* Collaborate closely with the creative and marketing teams to brainstorm ideas and produce content that resonates with target audiences.
* Maintain up-to-date industry knowledge to keep content fresh and relevant, leveraging trends and best practices in content creation and distribution.

  

Equal opportunities:  

  

At Fiverr, we prioritize diversity. We celebrate difference and embed it into every aspect of our workplace and product, as well as our community. Fiverr is proud and committed to providing equal opportunity employment to all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, citizenship, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. In addition, Fiverr will provide accommodation to individuals with disabilities or a special need.

title: Front Office Manager - The Soho Grand Hotel
description:
**Position Summary:**

The Front Office Manager at The Soho Grand Hotel has excellent communication skills with the ability to motivate and train a large team of passionate individuals. Is present in the day-to-day operations and is held accountable for each team member. Serving as a role model for impeccable guest service, the Front Office Manager is service-focused and committed to creating a unique and memorable experience for each guest through their attention to detail and anticipation of guest needs. The Front Office Manager is focused on building revenues through upselling, recognizing repeat business, and setting the example with exemplary guest service. This individual is hands-on in the day-to-day operations of the Front Office ensuring team members feel supported and heard while assisting the Director of Front Office Operations in administrative tasks like payroll, inventory and scheduling

**Manager’s Role:**

The expectation of a Manager at The Roxy Hotel is to support the hotel’s culture and goals. To foster a fair, fun, challenging, and rewarding work environment for their team, one in which each person is treated as an individual and as an important participant in the operation of the business.

Focus on training and motivation, ensuring your teams are equipped with all the tools needed to be able to deliver exceptional guest service enabling them to create unique experiences for each guest in a sophisticated, friendly and genuine manner. Our service vision delivers service that is designed not just to meet or exceed the expectations of our guests, but to anticipate their needs and deliver the unexpected. That means providing service that is knowledgeable, responsive, memorable, accurate, and consistent.

**Essential Functions:**

* Oversee the Front Office and the daily routine operation while providing coaching and motivation for all of the team members
* Create an environment that encourages empowerment
* Oversee Front Desk, Guest Services, and Front Service Team during the shift
* Maintain a constant presence in Front Office areas and public spaces to ensure guest satisfaction and support the Team Members
* Check guests in/out of rooms; ensure that all guest information is accurate and up to date
* Handle all guest payment for charges incurred; correct guest bills as needed
* Processing all guest email requests, copies, faxes, and packages; work with the Receiving department to ensure prompt and efficient delivery of packages to the guest
* Answer the phone, take room reservations, and ensure that guests’ requests are met
* Input all guest and/or team member requests, complaints, or issues into Guestware; dispatch the appropriate team member to take care of the issue; follow up to ensure guest/team member satisfaction; placing follow up phone calls as needed
* Pre-block all guests with special requests, repeat guests, and long term guests
* Pre-block and pre-key all redeyes and room protects
* Manipulate sold out situations
* Handle the relocation of guests when needed
* Administrative tasks include schedules & payroll, supplies & inventory and department month end reporting
* Oversee group arrivals and special requests as dictated on the resume
* Handle and accommodate all guest requests, room moves and complaints with professionalism and in accordance with established standards
* Review team member paperwork, banks, and end of shift audits for accuracy
* Assist Director of Front Office in ensuring that monthly and yearly goals are met
* Perform all other duties as assigned by management

**Peripheral Functions:**

* Create and revise standard operating procedures
* Create motivational and incentive programs for the Team
* Conduct pre-shift meetings with all team members

**Job Knowledge and Skills:**

* Computer efficiency
* Opera (PMS)
* Dayforce (payroll)
* Microsoft programs
* VingCard (key system)
* Guestware (CRM)
* Fax and copy machine
* Knowledge of cashier function
* Knowledge of how to work a CB radio

**Work History:**

* Minimum two year management experience in the hotel field

Digital Homes is looking for a talented Media Pro to join our team in NYC. We're a company that values the art of visual storytelling, and understands the impact of human connection in real estate media. If you're passionate about producing high-quality visuals and enjoy working in a creative and innovative environment, we want to hear from you.



Unlike standard "photo mill" style RE Media companies, Digital Homes values your creativity and your time. Our internal team handles marketing, scheduling, editing, and asset delivery to our clients. **Our Media Pros get to be exactly that; photographers, videographers and drone operators, while Digital Homes handles the rest.**



### **About Us:**



At Digital Homes, we believe that every property has a story waiting to be told. Our mission is to create compelling visual content that highlights the unique features of each home, helping real estate agents showcase properties in the best light. We prioritize quality, authenticity, and long-term relationships with our clients.



### **Responsibilities:**


* **Photography and Videography:** Capture high-quality images and videos of real estate properties, emphasizing their unique features and appeal.
* **Drone Work:** Use drone technology to provide breathtaking aerial shots that enhance the overall property presentation.
* **Floor Planning:** Develop precise and detailed floor plans to give a clear layout of the property.
* **Client Interaction:** Maintain strong relationships with real estate agents and clients, understanding their needs and ensuring their satisfaction.
* **Creative Collaboration:** Work closely with our editing team to ensure the final product meets our high standards and tells a compelling story.
* **Innovation:** Stay updated with the latest trends and technologies in real estate media to continuously improve our service offerings.

### **Qualifications:**


* **Experience:** Proven experience in real estate **photography and videography**, including drone and floor planning work.
* **Technical Skills:** Proficiency with DSLR or mirrorless cameras, drone technology, and editing software like Adobe Photoshop, Lightroom, and Premiere Pro.
* **Communication:** Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to connect with clients and team members effectively.
* **Creativity:** A keen eye for detail and a passion for visual storytelling.
* **Adaptability:** Ability to manage multiple projects independently in a fast-paced environment.

### **Why Digital Homes?**


* **Collaborative Environment:** Join a team that values creativity, collaboration, and continuous learning.
* **Quality Focus:** We prioritize delivering top-notch media that stands out in the real estate market.
* **Long-Term Vision:** We are committed to the long-term success of our clients and team members.
* **Human Connection:** Build meaningful relationships with clients and colleagues in a culture that values genuine interaction.
* **Competitive Compensation:** Enjoy a competitive compensation and opportunities for professional growth.


Caitlyn Barrick



Director of Operations



caitlyn@digitalhomes.io

title: Crew Member (Morning/Afternoon)
description:
**About us**

Buttermee Pancakes seeks to bring innovation and new excitement to one of America's most loved breakfast items... pancakes! Our tiny, round, crispy bites of buttermilk mini pancakes are a warm hug on a Sunday morning. Donating 10% of all proceeds to mental health care, Buttermee Pancakes is on a mission to spread joy throughout the nation by highlighting pancakes whilst providing a classic American brunch experience.

Our work environment includes:

* Free mini pancakes
* Flexible working hours
* Bonus eligibility for all employees
* Lively atmosphere

**Pancakes. Happiness. Fun. Are you in?** 

Buttermee Pancakes is seeking talented, expressive Buttermee Bunch members who strive to provide excellent mini pancakes and services in an efficient, professional manner. Members of the Buttermee bunch foster positive guest experiences by understanding recipes, performing quality checks on ingredients and finished products, using sauces, butter, and other toppings to enhance item presentation, and processing orders from guests.

As a member of the Buttermee Bunch, your days will be filled with greeting and engaging guests, crafting delicious pancake batter, flipping and styling mini pancakes, cleaning workstations and equipment, and performing other duties as needed.

To be a successful Buttermee Bunch member, you should be efficient, friendly, focused on food quality and guest satisfaction, decisive, and greatly detail-oriented. If you have a passion for food service and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment, we would love to hear from you.

**Buttermee Bunch Responsibilities**

* Heat, flip and style mini pancakes
* Read and understand Buttermee recipes
* Measure and combine ingredients using mixers, blenders, heat sources, and other equipment to make pancake batter and corresponding topping
* Testing ingredients and finished goods to ensure that each item meets food safety and quality controls
* Greeting customers, answering questions, making recommendations, accepting orders and payment, and providing exceptional customer service
* Keeping records relating to deliveries, inventory, and production levels
* Taking client information and ensuring that deliveries accurate and timely
* Cleaning and restocking the workstation and ensuring all equipment is sanitized and prepared for the next shift
* Participating in off-site mini pancake catering events

**Member Requirements**

* Strong communication, time and resource management, and planning skills
* Ability to work effectively in a team setting
* Attention to detail, especially when performing quality inspections on ingredients and products
* Basic math and computer skills
* Willingness to work independently or with other team members to solve problems, plan schedules, fulfill orders, and create excellent baked goods
* Flexibility to work around customer demands, including early morning, night, weekend, and holiday availability
* Ability to lift 50lbs occasionally
* Stand, walk, bend, use hands, and appliances, and lift heavy items for extended period
* Culinary background or training is beneficial but not required

If you are looking for an exciting opportunity to be part of a dynamic team serving pancakes in fun atmospheres, please submit your application today. We offer flexible scheduling, opportunities for growth within our organization, and **bonus eligibility** for **all** employees. Join us at Buttermee Pancakes and be part of creating memorable dining experiences for our valued guests.

title: Accounting Analyst - Full Time
description:
Reports to: Director of Finance

*When applicable for the job, “SCS currently* *has a hybrid work model with three days in office and two days remote.”*

**Description:**

The Accounting Analyst provides fiscal management for Home Health Aid training program as well as portfolio of Unrestricted grants, grant proposal support, compliance reporting, related auditor interface and the preparation of annual budgets and forecasts. This position will provide support to Accounts Payable and PR functions and will provide daily entries for Cash Receipt Government and Foundation Payments, Donations, Client Payments, and Unrestricted Funding. The position will work closely with the Director of Finance and should possess a clear understanding of General Accepted Accounting Principles.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:** 

· Develop and present complex analysis, prepare budget proposals, budget modifications, forecast and financial analysis related to Home Health Aid contracts and Unrestricted Funding.

· Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual cost reports.

· Manage Emergency grant funding, create Vendor profiles, post entries and issue payments.

· Understanding accounting principles applied to Restricted and Unrestricted grants.

· Assist Director of Finance and Controller on audit reviews and year end audits.

· Understanding AR, Advance Payments, AP Credit Memos and how to reverse accrual monthly entries. Proper understanding of TB reports to identify and correct entries on a timely basis.

· Cash Receipt deposits for cash, live checks and electronic deposits from clients, donors, and funder payments. Daily post electronic payments from corporate account to accounting software.

· Ability to understand Organizational charts and workflow to enhance backup support experience and turnaround requirements.

· Manage AP vendors assigned to portfolio. Create Vendor profiles, review cost allocations, ensure proper documentation and post entry.

· In charge of monthly Intercompany Group and Individual Respite invoice reconciliation, upload, and payments.

· Record monthly intercompany billing from Affiliate company. Review allocations and ensure proper record keeping.

· Assist with various accounting reports in preparation for monthly closing of AP.

· Ability to cross-train and serve as backup for AP and PR Specialist positions.

· Must be able to work independently, in groups and willing to be assigned to help team members to achieve department goals.

**Qualifications:**

· BA or BS in Accounting or related field and at least 2 years of proven experience working with CBO.

· Excellent oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills.

· Must have demonstrated ability to handle multiple tasks and independent assignments.

· Experienced with accounting software (Fund EZ) a plus.

· Experience working with Government funding and private foundations.

· Strong knowledge of Excel.

· Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.

**SCS offers an Excellent Benefits Package:**

Comprehensive medical, dental and vision insurance

403B pension plan with employer contribution

Flexible spending account and transit benefits

Employee Assistance Program

20 days of paid vacation and 12 paid sick days per year

10 paid Holidays

Six personal/floating days

Life Insurance

title: Home Infusion Registered Nurse - Per diem
description:
**Jesdit Infusion LLC Updated Job Description**

Jesdit Infusion is a fast-growing company that is seeking highly skilled and compassionate nurses throughout the New Jersey area. The primary role of a home infusion nurse is to provide clinical care, education, and excellent customer service to patients in their private residence and ambulatory infusions sites, where available. All infusion therapies, medications and medical supplies are provided by pharmacies and authorized by the patient’s doctor. As an in-home infusion nurse, not only will you be treating the patient, you will also have to work collaboratively with pharmacies and doctors to provide the highest quality care for your patients. This position does require traveling to patient homes, and an ideal candidate will be able to travel at least 40-45 minutes from their home to visit their patients for the duration of their treatment and be comfortable in diverse home settings.

Requirements:

* Current, unrestricted RN license for the state of New Jersey
* BLS/ACLS certification
* Valid driver’s license and auto insurance
* Clean background check
* In-depth knowledge of HIPPA policies and procedures
* Personal Liability Insurance
* Reliable personal transportation.
* Must have excellent IV skills (CRNI preferred)
* Competent at PICC line maintenance, port access/de-access Midline and PIV placement
* Minimum of 2 years of infusion experience. An ideal candidate will have experience with IVIG, SCIG, TPN, Remicade, Gammunex, Gammaguard, Entyvio and antibiotics such as Vancomycin Daptomycin etc.
* Bachelors degree in Nursing is preferred
* In-depth understanding of regulatory compliance with state and federal regulators
* Strong interpersonal skills and ability to interact with all patients and their families in a compassionate and professional manner
* Pediatric care competency highly preferred but not required

Duties

Job duties vary by patient, medication, and doctor orders. All patients, unless specified otherwise, are to be seen on a weekly or monthly basis. While not an exhaustive list, duties include:

* Picc line dressing changes
* Port accessing/de-accessing.
* Lab draws,
* Patient assessment and teaching
* Troubleshoot equipment issues with patient (ad hoc basis)
* Milrinone hookups and bag changes
* Chemo disconnects (home setting or hospital setting)
* Infusing medication such as IVIG, SCIG, antibiotics, Remicade, Stelara, Solumedrol, Entyvio, Orencia, IV hydration and TPN
* Starting a PIV line and drawing blood for lab work and for infusions
* Deliver blood specimens to Labcorp or another lab facility (ad hoc basis)
* Fill out and submit all paperwork in a timely manner per company policy.

Schedule

Due to the nature of this position, the ability to work weekdays, weekends, days and nights are required. Must have a flexible schedule to devote at least 1 day a week to taking care of a minimum of 3 weekly cases.

Pay Rate

Regular Visit: Flat rate of $80.00 (includes initial assessment, medication education, medication administration, weekly bloodwork, weekly picc line dressing changes, port access/de-access, and chemo disconnect.

Hourly Rate: $50.00 an hour.

title: Healthcare Stock Person
description:
**Job Title:** Healthcare Stock Person  
**Location:** New York , NY

**Job Summary:**

The Healthcare Stock Person is responsible for maintaining and organizing inventory within a healthcare setting, such as a hospital, clinic, or pharmacy. This role involves receiving, stocking, and distributing medical supplies, equipment, and medications. The Stock Person ensures that inventory levels are accurate and that supplies are readily available for healthcare professionals to provide uninterrupted patient care.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Inventory Management:** Receive and inspect incoming shipments of medical supplies, equipment, and medications. Verify quantities and quality against purchase orders.
* **Stocking and Organizing:** Store items in designated areas following proper procedures to maintain a clean and organized stockroom. Rotate stock to ensure the earliest expiration dates are used first.
* **Order Fulfillment:** Pick and distribute supplies and equipment to various departments based on requisitions and orders, ensuring timely delivery.
* **Inventory Control:** Conduct regular inventory counts, track stock levels, and report discrepancies or low-stock situations to the inventory manager.
* **Quality Assurance:** Ensure all items are correctly labeled, stored under appropriate conditions, and compliant with safety and infection control standards.
* **Communication:** Collaborate with other departments to understand their supply needs and address any concerns or issues related to stock availability.
* **Record Keeping:** Maintain accurate records of all inventory transactions, including receipts, distributions, and returns. Update inventory management systems accordingly.
* **Compliance:** Follow all healthcare regulations, safety guidelines, and organizational policies regarding handling and storage of medical supplies.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $18.00 - $20.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

* Health insurance
* Paid time off

title: Regional Clinical Director
description:
**About the role:**



Effective School Solutions, a well-established and rapidly expanding organization that is changing the nature of in-school mental health services for elementary, middle school and high school students, is looking for a top tier mental health leader to join its team as a Regional Clinical Director. The Regional Clinical Director will provide supervision and oversight to Effective School Solutions clinicians to all school districts in their assigned region\\*, leading the therapeutic programs and managing the relationship with partner district personnel. This role is perfect for someone who has a strong combination of clinical and relationship skills and is looking to make a broad impact in supporting the mental health of at-need students. Regional Directors travel up to 4 days per week in their region to support with program implementation, account management, and clinical guidance.



The ideal candidate should possess strong clinical and therapeutic skills and have prior experience working with adolescent students. The candidate should also have the communication skills and relationship skills necessary to interact with school district leaders in an advisory capacity, and the project management and supervisory skills necessary to lead ESS clinicians and to lead ESS work in improving mental health outcomes in school districts. The candidate will work with a highly seasoned and professional management team that provides the best possible clinical services.


* Assigned region may include multiple counties and is subject to change based upon business needs.


**Key Responsibilities:**


**Clinical Oversight:**


* Oversee the provision of clinical services to clients of the practice, ensuring adherence to evidence-based practices and culturally inclusive approaches.
* Collaborate with clinical staff to develop and implement treatment plans that align with the needs of students and the objectives of partnering school districts.
* Provide clinical supervision and support to licensed professionals within the practice.


**Strategic Leadership:**


* Lead efforts to expand service offerings, reach new clients, and foster partnerships with school districts and other stakeholders.
* Stay informed about trends and best practices in mental health and education, integrating new insights into practice operations.


**Personnel Management:**


* Oversee the hiring, training, and supervision of clinical and administrative staff.
* Conduct performance evaluations and provide feedback to staff members to support their professional development.
* Address personnel issues promptly and in accordance with established policies and procedures.


**Financial Management:**


* Collaborate with finance team to develop and monitor budgets for clinical operations.
* Ensure the efficient use of resources and the achievement of financial targets.
* Identify opportunities for revenue growth and cost containment measures.


**Stakeholder Engagement:**


* Cultivate and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including school district leaders, community organizations, and regulatory agencies.
* Represent ESS at meetings, conferences, and other events to promote our services and mission.
* Respond to inquiries and concerns from stakeholders in a timely and professional manner.


 **Qualifications and Skills**


* 8+ years of clinical experience treating children and/or adolescents with significant behavioral and emotional challenges is required.
* Must hold a valid clinical license from the state in which the position is being offered in one of the following areas: Social Work, Counseling, or Marriage and Family Therapy. (If region includes multiple states, obtaining licensure in additional state is required).
* 3+ years of supervisory experience in a clinical setting; certification to supervise licensees for licensure is required.
* Prior experience working in a clinical capacity within a school-based program is a plus.
* Excellent organization skills, attention to detail and a solution focused approach to problem solving is preferred.
* Must have reliable transportation
* Must be flexible and available for travel throughout assigned region
* Must be proficient in Microsoft Office and comfortable using a computer.
* Must be able to complete clinical documentation to ESS standards.


 **Why join Effective School Solutions?**


* ESS is focused on addressing one of the biggest challenges our country is facing - - the mental health of our youth.
* ESS is a dynamic organization with a strong record of accomplishment of innovation and growth.
* ESS provides staff with excellent career growth opportunities.
* ESS provides extensive time off tied to the school calendar, with limited summer hours. ESS prioritizes and gives value to a clinician's work-life balance.
* ESS offers staff competitive compensation and benefits offerings.
* ESS values clinician voice and perspective and has multiple methods to give feedback and input on company decisions.


 ESS is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.
company_description: ESS continues to be a leader in in-school mental health partnering with school districts to provide in-district clinical solutions to help students with emotional and behavioral challenges.

title: Guest Service Representative/Night Auditor
description:
We are currently seeking experienced, energetic, and customer-service focused Hotel **Guest Services Representatives/Night Audit, for the Parsippany Holiday Inn & Suites** We currently have openings for **both Full-Time and Part-Time** . Candidates must be self-driven, goal-oriented, and work well within a successful team environment.Guest Services Representatives are responsible for providing attentive, courteous, and efficient service to all guests prior to arrival and throughout their stay, while maximizing room revenue and occupancy. Primary responsibilities include; greeting guests, registering guests, making and modifying reservations, hotel operator, and concierge duties.The ideal candidate will have prior hotel front desk experience with Opera PMS & IHG Standards preferred. This position requires an upbeat, dependable, and responsible individual that is willing to ensure 100% guest satisfaction at all times. This person will assist in meeting all guest needs from check in to check out, giving directions, assisting with issues, and helping ensure that all guests have a 100% satisfaction stay.What you will be doing

* Providing information to guests about hotel policies, services and amenities
* Responding to requests from guests for assistance and information about the local area (e.g. directions, places to eat)
* Selling rooms to “walk in” customers
* Entering/changing reservations information on the computer
* Posting charges to guests accounts
* Processing payments from guests
* Making necessary corrections to guest accounts
* Informing housekeeping department about room status/availability
* Listening and responding to guests’ requests and complaints
* Operating hotel switchboard
* Cleaning the front desk area
* Maintaining daily logs
* Balancing shift work and cash drawers

BenefitsWe offer a competitive medical, dental and vision plan with 50% contribution

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $13 /hour

Job Location:

* Parsippany, NJ 07054

Required education:

* High school or equivalent
* IHG Certified A Plus , Knowledge Of Opera PMS A plus

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $17.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Free parking
* Paid jury duty
* Paid time off

Work Location: In person

title: Accountant/Tax Preparer
description:
Reputable accounting office in Plainview, NY providing comprehensive financial services to a diverse clientele of all sizes. We are committed to delivering accurate and timely accounting, consulting & tax solutions while fostering a supportive and collaborative work environment.

**Job Summary:**

We are currently seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Accountant / Tax Preparer to join our accounting business. Our office provides our team with a casual & friendly work environment and flexible schedule that allows them the ability to grow both professionally and personally. This role is a can be Part-Time, Full-Time or Contract (for the right candidate), this is an **in person position** ( with additional hours during tax season) in our office and is perfect for someone who possesses strong accounting & tax skills . **This is NOT a remote, evening or weekend position**. The position is available for an immediate start.

**Responsibilities:**

* Tax preparation (individuals, corporations & partnerships.
* Finalizing Balance Sheet & Profit & Loss Statements
* Must be up to date with current tax laws.
* Assist with responses to tax notices.
* Assist clients with tax & accounting related questions.
* Data entry in CCH tax software.

**Qualifications:**

* Prior Accounting firm experience is a must.
* Must know how to use Quick Books Online & Desktop versions.
* Proven experience within an accounting or finance environment is a plus.
* Strong computer skills, including proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook).
* Excellent organizational skills and ability to prioritize tasks effectively to meet deadlines.
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy, with a focus on maintaining high-quality work.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact with clients and team members professionally.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive financial information.
* Knowledge of CCH Prosystems helpful, but not required.
* Knowledge of payroll & sales tax helpful.

**Salary: $35 - $45 per hour, depending on experience.**

**How to Apply:** To apply for this position, please submit your resume in word or PDF format, a cover letter outlining your relevant experience, and any other supporting documents. We appreciate all applications, but only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We encourage individuals of all backgrounds and abilities to apply.

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Pay: $30.00 - $40.00 per hour

Expected hours: No less than 16 per week

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Quick Books Online & Desktop: 5 years (Required)
* Accounting Firm: 3 years (Required)

Language:

* English (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Operations Assistant @ Tea Company (Part-Time)
description:
Senbird Tea is an AAPI family-owned Japanese tea company. We bring you the finest tea from family farms in Japan. With a focus on wellness and sustainability, we're dedicated to inspiring more moments of appreciation through our organic tea collection, premium gift sets, and handcrafted teaware. Join our journey to share the rich traditions of Japanese tea in nurturing a healthy mind, body, and spirit.

**WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR**

We are looking for an organized and reliable **Operations Assistant** to support all office and production operations. This individual will handle product inventory and product creation, order fulfillment, office organization, and potentially event support as needed. The responsibilities include reporting directly to the manager and fulfilling operations duties in the manager’s absence. As a Operations Assistant, you will:

* Maintain an organized, clean, and efficient office environment for production
* Pack, deliver, and fulfill all D2C & B2B orders from all sales channels as needed
* Ensure goods are packed to meet the stipulated quantity and quality standards
* Oversee producing necessary product inventory
* Monitor product inventory and office supplies
* Report inventory and office supply needs to management and be accountable for replenishing low stock items for production and order fulfillment
* Package, pick up, organize, and deliver packages that may weigh up to 50 lbs
* Analyze all operations to share suggestions for improvement
* Improve quality, productivity, and profitability of processes and procedures
* Uphold a safe, welcoming, and collaborative team culture and work environment

**You have:**

* Interest in hands-on operations and/or e-commerce
* Efficient, organized, reliable, curious, and friendly personality
* Ability to handle multiple priorities and work on various projects in parallel
* Good manual dexterity and ability to perform repetitive tasks with accuracy
* Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with team members
* Strong organization, critical thinking, and interpersonal skills
* Bilingual Japanese and English is a huge plus!

**Requirements:**

* Open-minded, a fast learner, enthusiastic, and adaptable personality
* Possess attention to detail, efficiency, flexibility, variety, and growth potential
* Self-motivated and must be able to work independently as well as part of a team
* Love for tea with an interest in Japanese culture
* 1-2 years of order fulfillment experience

**You are:**

* **A multi-tasker:** When it comes to handling multiple projects at once, you're a pro; anticipating every project need before it's needed. You have great analytical, scheduling, and management skills.
* **Communicative:** You provide clarity in communication, both in verbal and written form. Your calm and direct approach to communication is immediately recognized, whether you're delivering a presentation, hosting a meeting, or sending a simple email.
* **Motivated:** You commit to quality. Under the pressure of a tight deadline, you can maintain a flexible, positive approach to assignments and overcome a challenge. You're effective and organized, providing sound judgment and decision-making abilities.

**Job Type:** Part-Time (opportunity to become full-time based on performance)

**Schedule:** 3 days per week, 8-hour shifts

**Work Location:** NY-based, in-person

**Compensation:** $17.25 per hour

**Benefits:**

* Flexible schedule – work/life balance is important!
* Free tea – wellness is one of our core values
* Employee discounts – your friends and family will enjoy it!
* Professional development and mentorship – we want to support your career growth

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $17.25 per hour

Expected hours: 24 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Professional development assistance

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Day shift

Experience:

* Order fulfillment: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Porter/Maintenance
description:
**Capital Realty Group Inc (CRG)** is a national leading Affordable Housing Company specializing in affordable housing industry, ranked # 1 in 2019 by AHF.

As a vertically integrated company we maintain in-house capacity across all multifamily facets, including in house acquisitions, full development & construction team, property management, compliance, and social services.

We are guided by our core values in excellence, driven by determination to provide best in class quality affordable Housing to our many families and seniors whom we serve.

CRG is now seeking to hire a *Janitor* to add to our amazing team**.**

**Duties and responsibilities include:**

* Physically walks the communities daily to remove litter and other small debris from the grounds
* Cleans and prepares apartments after move-outs for new rental
* Works with maintenance team to report any issues requiring attention
* Keeps an inventory of cleaning supplies and equipment
* Daily cleaning and trash pickup on the property and common areas which include, work out areas, laundry facilities, leasing office, club house, pool, and public restrooms
* Ensures cleanliness in work areas before, after and upon completion
* Assists office staff with any postings of notices to be put on resident doors
* Reports to supervisor regarding work status
* Monitors grounds, buildings, and work areas for cleanliness, safety, and repairs that need to be addressed
* Follows company policies and procedures for all applicable federal and state laws
* Promotes quality living experience for all current and future tenants expressed through excellent customer service skills
* Participates in company provided training such as fair housing, safety, non-discrimination, and harassment prevention.
* May be requested from supervisors to perform other tasks from time to time

**The ideal candidate would possess the following characteristics:**

* Reliable, Self-motivated, Honest, Detail-oriented
* Service-oriented
* Ability to follow directions and work as a team
* Grounds/landscaping experience preferred but not required
* Bilingual - Spanish Speaking Preferred

We sincerely value every member of our team, and we hire for the long-term, so if you're looking for a career, please apply!

We look forward to hearing from you!
